caption: Nourishing myself and preparing myself for a really busy day tomorrow. 🙃 Luckily I have lots of leftovers of this red lentil chili remaining for lunch tomorrow to help fuel me. 😬 Will think happy thoughts and dream of chili for the time being. This chili is hearty and gets an extra kick from a little ginger and chipotle powder. 🙌🏽 . Red Lentil Chipotle Chili 1 cup green lentils 1 cup red lentils 1/2 red onion, diced 1 red bell pepper, diced 1 15 oz can diced tomatoes 2 tbsp tomato paste 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 inch fresh ginger, minced 2 tsp smoked paprika 1 tsp chipotle powder 2 tsp chili powder 1 tsp cumin 2 tbsp maple syrup 4 cups vegetable broth Salt and pepper to taste . In a medium pot add onions and sauté until softened, 3 minutes. Add in red bell pepper, garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant. Add in tomato paste and seasonings. Stir in pan for 2-3 minutes allowing them the become fragrant. Add tomatoes, lentils, maple syrup and vegetable broth. Stir to combine and bring to a boil, then reduce to a low heat and allow to cook for 30-40 minutes or until lentils are soft and tender and chili is thick. . If cooking in the instapot, set instapot to sauté and follow all steps as detailed above when adding ingredients. When all ingredients are in the instapot, seal the top and set it to manual pressure for 10 minutes. Allow for natural pressure release and stir pot well before serving. 🥣

So another secret. I’m not good at making overnight oats. 😌I guess let me clarify...I’m not good at making them “overnight” because I forget to set them the night before. 🤦🏽‍♀️ So I’ll typically make them morning of as soon as I wake up. I’ll grab a bowl or jar, add the ingredients and just let it sit in the fridge for about 30 minutes to an hour. Once I get hungry, just add my toppings and it’s perfect every time. 🤣 Why go through the trouble? It’s been hot here and the coolness of the oats is very inviting at the moment. But if you want them heated you can always heat them up in the microwave or in the stove top. 🙃 . Easy Overnight Oats 1/3 cup rolled oats 1 tbsp chia seeds 3/4 cup unsweetened almond milk 1/4 tsp cinnamon Pinch of nutmeg 1 mashed medjool date or 1 tsp maple syrup Pinch of salt . Stir all ingredients together and allow to sit in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to 1 hour. Give a good stir before serving. Feel free to top with fruit of choice. I went with maple caramel almond butter from @georgiagrinders, strawberries, diced banana, and cacao nibs. 🍓

I know I cook a lot of chickpeas, but I love chickpeas and these mustard chili chickpeas were so lovely. 🌶 Just paired it with some plantains, avocado, cauliflower and greens. 🥣 . Catching up with comments and messages. Apologies for being slightly MIA. I’ve felt overwhelmed and needed a mini break for my brain. Thank you for your patience everyone! 🌻 . Mustard Chili Chickpeas 1 small onion, diced 1 green bell pepper, diced 1 stalk celery, diced 4 cloves garlic, minced 2 tbsp soy sauce 1/2 tsp adobo seasoning 1 tsp sazón (or an extra tsp of chili powder) 2 tsp chili powder 1/2 tsp smoked paprika 2 cans chickpeas, rinsed and drained 2 tsp brown mustard 1/4 cup vegetable broth or water 2 tsp sugar or maple syrup Salt and pepper to taste . Heat a medium pan over medium heat, add diced onion, bell pepper and celery. Sauté to, allowing onion to become translucent, about 2-3 minutes. Add in garlic and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. Add in seasonings and sauté for 1 minute then stir in soy sauce. Add chickpeas and mustard and sauté to coat. Add sugar and broth and stir to combine. Allow to simmer for about 8-10 minutes or until chickpeas are coated. Salt and pepper to taste then serve. ❤️

Happy Sunday to everyone! 🌞Starting my day off with a bowl of snickerdoodle oatmeal because I needed that comfort. ✨Obviously you need that cinnamon sugar combo, but to make it a little richer, making this with a spoon of cashew butter (@georgiagrinders) was everything. 🔥 . SNICKERDOODLE OATMEAL Cinnamon Sugar Topping 1 tsp sugar Pinch of cinnamon . Oatmeal 1/2 cup rolled oats 1/2 tbsp ground flax seed 1 tsp sugar Pinch of salt 1/2 tsp cinnamon 1 tsp vanilla extract 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 1 tbsp cashew butter . In a small bowl, combine pinch of cinnamon and 1 tsp of sugar and set aside. Add oats, ground flax seed, remaining tsp of sugar, cinnamon and salt to a sauce pan and stir to combine. Stir in cashew butter, vanilla extract and almond milk. Turn heat on and bring mixture to a simmer. Once simmering, begin to stir oatmeal and continue to slowly stir for about 3-5 minutes or until oats have thickened as desired. Remove oats from stove top and pour into serving bowl. Sprinkle cinnamon and sugar mixture over top surface of oatmeal and top with fruit if desired. . No cashew butter or allergy? Opt for another nut butter that suits your needs. Almond butter, tahini or sunflower seed butter works too. 🌻

I would say that a good majority of my meals are 100% random. 🥴 I just like too many things not to include them. At least for me it tastes good, and that’s all I’m concerned with. If you’re not enjoying what you’re eating, then what is the point? 🙃 This bowl includes some @lotusfoods rice ramen that I cooked and tossed with soy sauce and sriracha and a small amount of coconut milk (no seasoning packet was used for this), edamame, spring onions, baked BBQ tempeh, and baked gochujang cauliflower bites. 🌶 . If you aren’t sure what gochujang is, it’s a really flavorful and spicy, fermented red pepper paste (there are other ingredients mixed in as well). I remember the first time I purchased some, I was in H-Mart and a really kind Korean woman saw me staring endlessly at all the various pastes. She stopped what she was doing and was so excited to explain all the different pastes to me. She was so passionate about it and in turn it made me super passionate about it too. Always check ingredients to make sure it’s vegan, but other then that definitely enjoy if you get your hands on it. If you don’t have access to it, you can also sub in some sriracha (the flavor is not the same as sriracha is more garlic forward). 🥣 I am not an expert on Korean food, so highly recommend you also looking into this information from others that are more knowledgeable like @the.korean.vegan. . Gochujang Flavored Cauliflower Bites 1/2 a head of cauliflower, cut into 1 inch bites . Batter 1/4 cup flour 1 tbsp soy sauce Pinch of salt Pinch of pepper 1/2 tsp garlic powder 1/2 tsp dry basil 1 tsp paprika 1/2 to 3/4 cup of unsweetened almond milk . Sauce 1 tbsp tahini 1 tsp gochujang Splash of soy sauce Pinch of garlic Pinch of salt 3 tbsp water . Preheat oven to 425F. In a bowl combine batter ingredients and whisk together until smooth (you don’t want it to be too watery, so start with 1/2 cup liquid and if you need it thinner add a little bit more at a time). Add cauliflower to bowl and toss together to coat. Take each individual piece and shake off excess batter and place on a lined baking sheet and pop in the oven for 15-20 minutes. 🍓 Red is pretty. It’s also a very powerful color that is linked to the celebration of Juneteenth. 🍉Red foods, that beautiful crimson color is a symbol of ingenuity and resilience in bondage. 🍎It’s also deeper than that as it goes to its origin roots in West Africa as a symbol of strength, spirituality, and life and death. 🍒 And the foods used to celebrate on this day hold a lot of symbolic meaning and connects those today to those in past generations. Together, this day and the food helps to “reunite people, renew family ties and friendships, and affirm their humanity.” -Christina year Djossa (How Red Food and Drink Joined the Juneteenth Feast)✨ . To celebrate, I’m feasting on these fresh strawberries along with some caramelized bananas, cashew butter, cacoa nibs over this vanilla cardamom oats. 🍓Remember, we all still lots of work left to do, so don’t get complacent. . Vanilla Cardamom Oats 1/3 cup cup rolled oats 1/2 tbsp ground flaxseed 1/2 diced banana Pinch of cinnamon 1 cup boiling hot water Pinch of cardamom 1/2 tsp vanilla extract Pinch salt . In a bowl, add oats, flax, salt, cinnamon, cardamom and vanilla. Stir to combine and then add in hot water. Cover bowl with a plate and allow to sit for 1-2 minutes to thicken. Once thickened add diced banana and mix well to help enhance creaminess. Top with strawberries and extra toppings as desired. 🍓

Kind of talked about this salad briefly in my stories. ✨ Got some greens, cilantro, corn, cherry tomatoes, fajita tempeh, cucumber, some baked tortilla strips and some @88acres Smoky Chipotle dressing. 🌶Have been using more tempeh recently because I’m mildly obsessed with it. 🤣 . Fajita Tempeh Bites 1 block of tempeh, cubed 1 cup veggie broth 1 tbsp nutritional yeast 1 1/2 tsp fajita seasoning 1 tsp sriracha 2 tsp soy sauce . Set oven to 400F. Add all ingredients to a pan and bring to a simmer. Allow tempeh to cook and marinade in broth until most of liquid cooks off. Place bites onto lined baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. You can also place the tempeh in an airfrier at 370F for 5 minutes. . For the salad, I made my own tortilla strips and just baked them for about 3 minutes in the oven with the tempeh. 🌻

Every week I order cauliflower and I can see the internal groan that shows up in my husband’s eyes. 😭😂 He’s not the biggest fan of cauliflower or broccoli, but I consider them both necessary staples. To help encourage him to eat it, I find smothering it with tahini and different spices tends to do the trick. 🙃 If you ever want to encourage or broaden someone’s palate, smother it in sauce. Make it a positive experience for them and they might change their mind over time. Even if they don’t ever like it plain, you can proudly state that you at least got them to eat their veg. 🤣 . Cauliflower Steak 1 head of cauliflower 2 tbsp tahini or nut butter of preference*** 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 tsp smoked paprika 1 tsp garlic powder 2-3 tbsp water Salt and pepper to taste 🙌🏽 . Set oven to 425F. Cut cauliflower head into 3-4 even slabs. Add all remaining ingredients except cauliflower into a bowl and whisk together. Brush the cauliflower with the mixture on both sides. When completed, place in oven and bake for 15 minutes. Then set oven to high broil and allow to cook for an additional 5-8 minutes or until edges are golden. Allow to cool for at least 5 mins before serving. . *** Tahini is a fav and I have my preference. Used @soomfoods tahini for its smoothness and flavor. I have a discount code for them in my profile along with other fun resources. :)

Okay, 2 things! 🌻 . ☝🏽Hi, hello, you say you have nut allergies? Well, I just tried out something I was gifted by @kweenandco, granola butter, and it is absolutely delicious. Includes healthy fats (no nuts or seeds), low sugar, is runny, main ingredient is gluten free oats and tastes like if you turned Teddy Grahams into a nut butter spread. ✨ . ✌🏽I hear you my friends who dislike bananas. I have a new oatmeal recipe sans banana, hoping it can give you some ideas of how to upgrade your oatmeal bowls. 🥣 . Maple Pear Oats 1/2 cup rolled oats 1 tsp flax seed 1 finely diced pear 1-2 tsp maple syrup Pinch of salt Pinch of cinnamon 1 cup unsweetened almond milk . Add all ingredients to a sauce pan and bring to a simmer over low heat. Stir as oats cook allowing to thicken over a few minutes. Once at desired consistency, pour oats out to serve and top with fruit and any extra spreads. Today I went with mango, strawberries, blueberries, blackberries and some granola butter. 🥣

I had a long day, but during this long day I had a great conversation with another Hispanic, and after talking to her and making her more comfortable about eating tortillas and beans...I found myself really craving some stewed pinto beans. Normally when I’m with my mom, we’ll just say Habichuelas. ✨ Habichuelas Guisadas is just so good, and my mom makes them perfect every time. She’ll cook them all day, but I just don’t have the time to do the same. So I cheat a little bit and use a pressure cooker to help. 👏🏽 . Habichuelas Guisadas 1 lb dry pinto beans Water 1 tbsp tomato paste 1 tsp dry thyme 1/2 tsp adobo seasoning 2 tsp smoked paprika 2 tsp sazón (@eatloisa)** 1 jalapeño, diced 1 small red onion, diced 2 tbsp soy sauce 5 mushrooms, sliced (optional) 5 cloves garlic, minced 2 tbsp nutritional yeast Salt and pepper to taste . Add the beans to your instant pot insert and pour in enough fresh water to cover the beans by 1 inch. Allow to soak for at least 8 hours or over night. Rinse and drain water and then add fresh water back into the chamber, enough to cover the beans by 1 inch. Place into pressure cooker and set to manual and cook for 25 minutes and release pressure naturally. While pressure releases sauté onions in a separate pan with jalapeño and mushrooms until onions are translucent. Add in garlic and sauté until fragrant. Open instant pot remove and dump 1 cup of the cooking liquid out. Add in sautéed onion mixture along with all other seasonings and yeast. Hit the sauté button on the instant pot and allow mixture to come to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Stir on occasion until stew has thickened. You can help stew thicken more by lightly mashing the beans. Adjust salt. 🥣 . If you want to use canned beans, use 3 cans of pinto beans. Rinse and drain them and set aside. In a large pot add veggies and garlic as described and sauté as directed above. Add beans, soy, tomato paste and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Add in seasonings, yeast and then add 3 1/2 cups low sodium vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer and cook on low for 25-30 minutes. With a back of cooking spoon, lightly mash some of the beans to help thicken the stew. Adjust salt. 🥑

I’m definitely not a baker, but I like baked things. 👏🏽Being stuck at home has made me want to experiment with some fun easy recipes. 🥣One that I was working on for the longest time was this mug brownie. Cooks up in the microwave for 45 seconds and gets an extra chocolate flavor boost by adding a little splash of coffee. ☕️ I included a lot of details on ingredient swaps (gluten free option) and included oven instructions in case you don’t have a microwave. ✨ For more brownie fun, I added a scoop of vanilla @cadoicecream and it just was the best thing ever. 🤤 . Easy Vegan Mug Brownie 1 1/2 tbsp white wheat flour 1 1/2 tbsp sugar 2 tbsp cocoa powder Pinch salt 2 tbsp peanut butter 2 tbsp almond milk 1 tbsp brewed coffee 1 tbsp of chocolate chips or more if desired . In a mug, add all dry ingredients and stir with a fork. Add in peanut butter, coffee and almond milk then carefully stir with fork to create a wet batter. Carefully fold in chocolate chips. Feel free to top with additional chocolate chips or fold more in for extra fudginess. Place mug in the microwave for 45 seconds. Make sure to allow mug cake to rest and cool for a few minutes before enjoying.

A while ago I asked you guys, which pulses (beans/lentils) you wanted me to make more recipes for. ❤️ Overwhelmingly, a lot of you wanted more ways to enjoy lentils. So here’s another flavor profile for you using some petite lentils. Also, if you are wondering why there is an uptick in ginger in my recipes it’s because I literally have a medium sized paper bag of them in my fridge and I’m determined to use all of it. 😂 Served these lentils with purple Brussels sprouts (yes they are real), brown rice and avocado. 🥑 . Saucy Ginger Lentils 1/2 small onion, diced 1 jalapeño, diced (de-seed if you don’t like spice) Red bell pepper, de-seed and diced 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 inch fresh ginger, minced 1 tbsp tomato paste 1/8 tsp cinnamon 1 tsp smoked paprika 1 tsp sazón or packet (I used @eatloisa) 1 cup lentils (I used French lentils in particular for this dish, make sure to rinse well) 2 1/2 cups vegetable broth or water 1 tbsp tahini Salt to taste . Start by sautéing diced onions in a medium sauce pan over low medium heat until translucent. Add in garlic and ginger and continuously sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add 2 tbsp water to deglaze the pan and add in diced bell pepper, jalapeño, and tomato paste. Sauté for 30 seconds and then add in all dry seasonings. Continue to sauté until you smell the cinnamon bloom then add rinsed lentils. Add broth, stir to combine and bring to a boil. Once at a boil, cook for 5 minutes and reduce heat to a simmer. Allow lentils to cook covered for about 15-20 minutes, allowing broth to begin thickening. Remove lid and add tahini. Stir well and if desired continue cooking until lentils are at desired consistency. I cooked them to the point they were more saucy. If you want more of a stew, feel free to add an additional 1/2 cup of water to loosen them up. Adjust salt to your preference and serve. 🥣

In need of a good sleep in tomorrow. Happy Friday everyone. 🌞Needed a bit of rejuvenation after these last few weeks and this salad did that for me. Here are the deets for this bowl and if you’d like the dressing recipe, you can find it on my blog 👇🏽 . Massaged kale, diced up Boca spicy chik’n patty, roasted beets, cucumber and my ginger green goddess dressing. 🥒 The kale was massaged in a few tbsp of the dressing. 🥗Massaging your greens might sound weird, but it helps makes the greens tastier and easier to digest. Rub the greens between your fingers with some salt, acid and fat to help break down some of the fibers in the greens to make them softer and easier to digest. 🥣 Takes a few minutes, but you’ll notice your greens start to shrink in size and it makes kale taste amazing. 🥬 . Ginger Green Goddess Dressing 1 small avocado, pit removed and scoped out of skin 1 tbsp nutritional yeast 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, packed 1 spring onion, roughly chopped 2 cloves garlic 1 inch fresh ginger 1 tbsp yellow mustard 2 tsp maple syrup Juice of 1 lime Zest of 1 lime (optional) Salt to taste 3/4 cup water . Add all ingredients in the order listed to a blender or food processor. Set to blend on high speed until completely smooth. If too thick for your liking, adjust water by adding 2 tbsp at a time to the dressing and blending again. Once dresing is to your liking, pour dressing into a resealable container and place in fridge to completely cool before using. Dressing will keep for 4 days in the refridgerator. 🥬🥗

Strawberries and chocolate are just a match made in heaven. 🍓🍫This bowl wasn’t made on the stovetop and was still fast and easy for a busy day like today. 🥣 Enjoyed the bowl with some plums and strawberries and cacao nibs. 🌻 . Maple PB Oats 1/2 cup quick oats 1/2 tbsp ground flax seed 1/4 tsp cinnamon 1/2 tbsp coconut flakes 1 tbsp peanut butter 1 tbsp maple syrup Pinch of salt 1 cup boiling water from a tea kettle 1/2 mashed banana 1 tbsp chocolate chips . Combine oats, coconut flakes, flax, maple syrup, cinnamon and salt. Stir well and then add in hot water and mix again. Cover and allow to sit for about a minute then mix in mashed banana or add banana half and mash in bowl. Top with peanut butter, extra fruit and chocolate chips as desired. 🥄

Hello. My name is Catherine and I am in love with broccoli and tofu. Nice to meet you. 😂 Some of my meals might have similar elements to them, but that makes making dinners through out the week much easier. If you’re reading this caption, what meals do you always have on rotation at home? 🌻 . Today, to keep with our typical noodle meal of the week, I made some Thai curry noodles and sriracha baked tofu. Paired those with some greens and sautéed mushrooms and broccoli. 🥦 . Sriracha Tofu 1 block extra firm tofu, drained and pressed then cut into cubes 2 tsp sriracha 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 tbsp nutritional yeast Juice of half a lime . Set oven to 400F. If you aren’t sure what pressing your tofu means, do a quick search for pressing tofu in google or head over to my blog for instructions. Once pressed, cube and add tofu to a large tupperware container. Top with soy sauce, sriracha, and nutritional yeast. Seal container and give a few gentle shakes to help coat tofu in mixture. Place tofu on a baking tray and make sure tofu is spread out and not touching. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden. Squeeze lime over top before serving. . Curry Ramen Noodles 2 blocks rice ramen noodles (@lotusfoods) 2 tsp soy sauce 2 tbsp canned coconut milk/or 2 tsp oil of choice 1 tsp Thai curry paste 1 tsp sriracha Juice of half a lime Salt to taste . Cook noodles according to package. Drain noodles and rinse under cold water. Set aside in a bowl. In pan used to cook noodles, add coconut milk and curry paste. Sauté for about 1-2 minutes or until fragrant. Add noodles, soy sauce and sriracha and sauté to coat evenly. Remove from heat and add lime juice. Adjust salt to preference and serve. 🍜

Hrmmm...I’ve been baking a lot recently. 🥣 While I’m not a seasoned baker, I love playing around with different recipes. These blondies are sneaky just like my brownies and have beans in them, chickpeas specifically. I promise, they don’t taste like chickpeas at all! Probably closer to a chocolate chip cookie if anything. Easy to put together and super yummy. Hoping you all are having a good day. ✨ . Chickpea Blondies 1/2 cup rolled oats 2 tbsp coconut sugar OR brown sugar 1 tsp baking powder 1/4 tsp salt 1 can chickpeas (rinsed and drained) 1/2 cup maple syrup 1 tsp vanilla (optional) 1/4 cup peanut butter (swap for a seed butter if dealing with allergies) 1/3 cup dairy free chocolate chips + more to top with as desired 🥜 . Set oven to 350F. Place all oats, sugar, baking powder, and salt into the food processor and process it into a flour. Add in chickpeas and remaining liquid ingredients except chocolate chips into the food processor and process until batter is smooth. Scrap down sides to allow even blending. Once smooth, fold in chocolate chips. Spoon out mixture on to a 8x8 baking tray and place in the oven for 20 minutes. Allow blondies to completely cool before cutting into them.

Dinner from tonight. 💜 Made a different variation of the baked tempeh from the other day but cut it into chunks and paired with some avocado, greens, @lotusfoods brown rice pad Thai noodles and some baked purple cauliflower. 🥬 After cooking the noodles just drizzled with a mix of some lime juice, maple syrup, and soy sauce. 🥣 . Baked Tempeh 1 block of tempeh 1 small onion, diced Juice of 2 limes 1/4 cup rice vinegar 1 tbsp ketchup 2 tbsp soy sauce 1/2 tsp cumin 1/2 tsp black pepper 2 tsp smoked paprika 1 tsp thyme 1 tsp oregano 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 cup of vegetable broth 1/8 tsp salt (or to taste) . Set oven to 400F. Cut tempeh in half into 2 even blocks. With a knife, pierce into the tempeh at least 6 times on both sides. In a bowl, whisk together vinegar, ketchup, soy sauce, lime juice, and salt. Dice up the onion and set aside. Place tempeh blocks in a shallow bowl. Top with diced onion, garlic and remaining seasonings and pour over juice mixture all over the tempeh, making sure that tempeh is properly coated. Seal container and allow to sit for at least 30 minutes. Bring a sauté pan to medium heat, and place blocks of tempeh in the pan and sear for 2-3 minutes on both sides. Add marinade and vegetable broth and bring to a low simmer and cover. Allow tempeh to absorb most of the liquid, about 10 minutes. Take tempeh, and place on a baking tray. Season with a pinch of salt and pop in the oven to bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden. If using an air frier, add tempeh and bake at 370F for 8-9 minutes. Remove from oven and serve with vegetables and starch of your choice.

The weekends just can’t be weekends without pancakes. 🥞 And the peaches and nectarines this year have been out of this world yummy. 🍑Whenever they are this sweet, I always make it a point to grill some. They soften into the most gooey and decadent topping. Always worth it and it just made sense to me to add them to these pancakes. 🍽 . Coconut Peach Pancakes 1 ripe banana 1 tbsp ground flax seeds 2 tbsp water 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar 1/2 tsp vanilla extract 1/4 tsp salt 2 tsp baking powder 1 tsp baking soda 1 tbsp sugar or maple syrup 1 1/2 cups white whole wheat flour 1 1/4 cups coconut milk beverage (not canned) 2 tbsp coconut flakes 1 peach or nectarine, diced . Grilled Peaches 2 peaches/nectarines 1 tbsp maple syrup Pinch cinnamon Pinch nutmeg . Preheat a griddle/grill or pan. In a mixing bowl, add banana and with a whisk or fork mash banana until mostly smooth. Add in flax seed and water and give mixture a good stir and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Next add in apple cider vinegar, vanilla, salt, and sugar and mix this in well. Add in baking soda and baking powder. Stir well again and you will notice the mixture react and start to fluff up. Add in flour, coconut flakes and milk and mix to form a thick batter (avoid over mixing). Fold in peaches into the batter. When griddle is ready, scoop 1/4 cup of pancake batter onto griddle surface and cook for 2-3 minutes or until bottom of pancake is golden. Flip and cook other side for 2-3 minutes as well. Remove from heat and eat. 🥞 . While pancakes are cooking, combine sliced peaches, maple syrup, cinnamon and nutmeg. Toss to coat and then add to preheated grill. Grill for about 3-4 minutes or until grill marks start to appear and then flip to cook for an additional 3 minutes. Serve immediately with pancakes. :)

Had some left over coconut milk, so felt inclined to make a different curry inspired dish. 😌 This one has both tofu and lentils. Of course I had to pair this with some rice, broccoli and boiled plantains. 👏🏽 And for many of you that are new, if you have no idea what plantains are, here’s a brief run down. You might see these as bananas, but plantains are meant to be cooked. You can find both starchy and sweet varieties (green to yellowish/black respectively). A major staple in many cultures from Africa to the Caribbean islands and Central/South America. There are many ways to cook these and I have a few tutorials in my highlights about them if you ever want to experiment. 🙃 Anyway, on to this tasty dish.👇🏽 . Curried Tofu And Lentils 1/2 medium red onion, diced 1/2 green bell pepper, diced 1 small sweet potato, cubed 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 inch ginger, minced 1 tbsp tomato paste 1 tbsp curry powder 1 tsp cumin 2 tsp smoked paprika 1 15 oz can diced fire roasted tomatoes 1 cup green lentils 1 cup light or full fat coconut milk 1 block super firm tofu, cubed 1 1/2 cups vegetable broth . Stove Top Instructions Heat up your pan to medium heat and saute onion and green peppers until onion is translucent. Add in sweet potato, ginger and garlic and make sure to continue moving them around the pan to prevent them from burning. Add tomato paste along with spices and sauté until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Stir in lentils, diced tomatoes, coconut milk, give a good stir to fully combine. Gently fold in tofu along with vegetable broth. Bring mixture to a boil and then immediately reduce to a low simmer and allow to cook for 25-30 minutes or until lentils are tender. . Instant Pot Instructions Set Instant Pot to saute. Follow all instructions as you would if cooking on stove top. Once you've added the vegetable broth, switch Instant Pot to manual high pressure. Set timer to 13 minutes and make sure lid is set to seal. Allow pressure to release naturally. Remove lid and serve curry as desired.

While the kitchen is my therapy room, it’s also not a place I have the time to spend all day in. 💆🏽‍♀️So making fast dishes is essential for me as my time is especially precious these days. Have been really enjoying this quick coconut mango curry in particular recently and don’t think I’ll end up stopping any time soon. 🥭 For those that have made this dish recently, I thank you! You guys are absolutely amazing to share your recreations. ✨ . Coconut Mango Chickpea Curry 2 cans chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 small onion, diced 5-6 garlic cloves, minced 2 inch ginger, peeled and minced 1 cup thawed frozen mango or 1 fresh mango, diced Juice and zest of 1 lime 2 cans lite coconut milk or 3 cups unsweetened oatmilk 1 tsp Garam Masala 1 tbsp curry powder 1 tbsp tomato paste 2 cups chopped cauliflower florets 1 tbsp maple syrup or sugar (optional, good to add if your mango is not ripe) Salt to taste . In a large sauce pan or pot, add onion and sauté until softened. Add in ginger, garlic, tomato paste, curry powder and Garam masala. Stir and sauté for a minute or until fragrant. Add in cauliflower and a splash of milk and sauté an extra minute. Add chickpeas and remainder of milk. Stir together and bring to a simmer. Simmer on low heat for 10 minutes. Add in mango, stir and cook for another 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add the lime juice and zest. Stir, add salt to taste and/or sweetener as desired and serve. 🥭

Reasons I love food. 🥣 Food identifies us, connects us, tells stories, can be shared, can be expressive and ultimately sustains us. The more we look to diversify our food space, the more we can connect and learn from each other. ❤️ One of the reasons I became a dietitian was because I didn’t feel represented, so I did something about it. However, POC are still very much under represented even still as I approach my 6th year as a dietitian. There are many reasons for this. Becoming a dietitian is tough. It will soon be required to obtain a masters degree (it means we’re educated but that’s...💸💸), you need to do an UNPAID internship (often for 6-12 months 💸💸), and pay for the exam...it’s an investment. Many people can’t afford to do 6-12 months of unpaid labor. We need more POC in the health and wellness space. It almost feels like an exclusive club that only certain people have access to. But this space needs to be easier to access because us POC have fantastic and flavorful things to share. 🙋🏽‍♀️ . BBQ Chickpeas 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 tbsp tahini 2 tbsp favorite BBQ sauce Pinch of salt . Place all ingredients in a bowl and toss together to coat chickpeas evenly. Bake on lined baking sheet and place in the oven for 25 minutes. If you are using an airfrier, place chickpeas in airfrier and bake at 370F for 15 minutes or until crunchy. Remove chickpeas from oven and allow to completely cool. . Adobo Tahini Dressing 3 tbsp tahini Juice of one lemon 1 tsp miso paste 1/2 tsp smoked paprika 2 tsp maple syrup 1 tsp mustard 1/2 tsp garlic powder 1/4 tsp adobo seasoning 4 tbsp water Salt and pepper to taste . Smoky Adobo Chickpea Salad 1 romaine heart, chopped or 1 bagged salad BBQ Chickpeas 1 cup frozen fire roasted corn 1 avocado, chopped 1 cup roasted frozen broccoli 1/4 cup adobo tahini dressing . In a small bowl add in all dressing ingredients and whisk until smooth. Add more water 1 tbsp at a time if you want to make the consistency a little thinner to your liking. In a large bowl add greens and top with 1/2 the dressing. Toss to coat all romaine leaves. Toss in remaining ingredients plus remaining dressing and toss to coat again. Serve as desir

Thank you for your kindness if you chose to be. Thank you for being open minded and curious. Thank you for having tough conversations.
