To everyone stay safe and healthy (physically and mentally). ❤️ . Topped with mango, kiwi and strawberry along with a few pepitas and hemp hearts. 😌 . Zucchini Oats (think of it like zucchini bread) 1/3 cup rolled oats (or use 1/2 cup) 1/2 a small zucchini, grated 1/2 tbsp chia seeds 1 medjool date or 2 tsp maple syrup 1/4 tsp cinnamon Pinch of salt 1 cup unsweetened almond milk . Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a simmer. As this cooks, use spoon or spatula to break up the date as it softens and stir as oats thicken. Serve and enjoy.

Your struggle is my struggle. The color of your skin should not dictate the way you are treated. Black lives absolutely matter. You are loved. You are worth it. I stand with you as a Latina. . For those of you ready to say “all lives matter” or call those protesting “thugs”, take a moment and think of those currently being oppressed. They are people. They have NAMES. They have families and loved ones. Some will never see their loved ones again due to unnecessary police brutality. The people that protest are doing it because they are scared for their lives. They are trying to vocalize their anxiety, sadness, and fear. They want to be heard and treated equally. They don’t want to die. We need compassion more than ever. We need to listen and not just turn up our nose to these issues. . If you are feeling uncomfortable, just know that this discomfort can lead to positive change and growth. If these injustices seem new to you, it’s okay. Focus on the things you can do with your privilege to help others. We need to support each other, learn from each other in order to heal as a society. Together, we can bring peace and stop injustice. Not sure where to start? Swipe for some great resources thanks to the @goodgoodgoodco. You can also: . - Stay educated and be informed - Use your voice when necessary to fight injustices at home, with friends, and outside - Follow and support black activists, writers, businesses, and more - Contact your representatives by calling their offices or writing letters - Sign online petitions - Donate to reputable organizations - Register to vote — VOTE VOTE VOTE . “40 years from now would you like to look back and say that you closed your eyes, covered your ears, and excused, accepted, rationalized the systemic killing of fellow human beings? Or would you prefer to know you chose to use all your power, meager and small it may be, to support life, equality, hope and your fellow man?” - Pierce Brown #blacklivesmatter

Needing something comforting today. For me, it’s always in the form of rice and beans. This recipe always helps and comes together really quick. 🥣 . Easy Stewed Beans 2 can pinto beans, rinsed and drained 1 tsp sazon (find a vegetable based one either in the international aisle or by the company @eatloisa) 2 tsp smoked paprika 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 tsp dried oregano 1 red onion, diced 1 can rotel (or store brand diced tomatoes with green chili peppers) 2 tsp capers (optional) 2 cups veggie broth Handful of cilantro, roughly chopped . Bring a medium pot to low medium heat. Add in diced onion and sauté for about 2 minutes or until translucent. Stir in minced garlic and sauté continuously until fragrant, about 1 minutes. Add in seasonings and a splash of water and sauté until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add in beans, tomatoes and capers. Stir to incorporate well and add in veggie broth. Bring mixture to a simmer and reduce heat to low. Stir every few minutes to avoid sticking to the bottom of the pan and allow to cook for 15-20 minutes. Stir in cilantro. With the back of your cooking spoon, lightly mash beans to thicken broth. Feel free to adjust liquid more to your liking. Remove from stove and stir while adjusting salt to taste. Serve with rice and extra veggies. Makes about 4 servings.

A little kitchen hack for making a fast stew when you don't have a lot of time. 👩🏽‍🍳 #ad Use a garden vegetable soup as a main base and add some extra fixings to boost protein and creaminess. 🥣 Having some extra @rightfoods Garden Vegetable Soup on hand made for a super fast tahini chickpea stew without any chopping necessary! Was able to enjoy this with some rice after a long day of client calls. 😌 . 1 container of @rightfoods Low Sodium Garden Vegetable Soup 1/2 cup chickpeas 1 tbsp nutritional yeast 1 tbsp tahini 1/2 tsp smoked paprika 1/2 tsp thyme Juice of half a lemon . Add contents of vegetable soup into a saucepan along with chickpeas. Bring soup to a simmer and then add in smoked paprika, thyme, nutritional yeast and tahini. Stir well and allow to simmer for 8-10 minutes or until soup has reduced down. Add a squeeze of lemon to freshen up at the end. Serve as desired! . I always love recommending these soups by @rightfoods to those needing plant based that is convenient and uncomplicated. These soups are always plant-based, vegan, and Non-GMO certified. They are super tasty and so easy to use as is for a quick lunch or even as a starter to an amazing meal at home. You can find more of these products at Whole Foods, Sprouts, Kroger, Publix, Safeway, Wegman’s and more! #RightFoodsGoodness

What a week! 🙃 How many of you are happy it’s almost time for the weekend? 🙋🏽‍♀️ Have been stressed, but taking it in stride. Decided to put my energy to better use and took a few minutes to make a bowl of oatmeal and topped it with the most delicious nectarine of my life. 😍 I have a few more left and plan to have some fun with them this weekend, so stayed tune for some more nectarine love soon. Loooovve this time of year for produce. 🥰 . Coconut Cream Oatmeal 1/3 cup rolled oats 1 tsp coconut flakes 1/4 tsp cinnamon 1/4 tsp ginger 1/2 tsp vanilla extract 2 tbsp coconut cream 1 cup unsweetened coconut milk beverage (carton not can) 2 tsp maple syrup or 1/2 a mashed banana Pinch of salt . Add all ingredients to a sauce pan and bring to a low simmer. Allow oats to cook while stirring continuously to help maintain creaminess of oats. Should cook in 4-5 minutes. Once at desired consistency, serve as desired. I topped mine with nectarines, blackberries, blueberries, chocolate tahini and cacao nibs. 😌

Things are definitely feeling a bit nutty these days. 🤪 For those types of days I roll with it, making sure to give myself a point of self care and to also serve myself something yummy...usually always something involving noodles, tofu and peanut sauce for those particularly stressful days. 🥜 . Bowl>>> Includes a serving of @lotusfoods moringa pad Thai noodles, broccoli, cabbage, onions and baked tofu. Coated everything in my peanut sauce and then drizzled some extra sauce overtop. 🥣 . Peanut Sauce 3 tbsp natural peanut butter 2 tbsp low sodium soy sauce (opt for gluten free soy sauce or coconut aminos to make gluten free) 1 tbsp maple syrup 1 tsp sriracha 1 tsp mustard 1/4 tsp garlic powder 1/4 tsp ginger powder Juice of half a lime 2-3 tbsp water . Add all ingredients to a bowl and whisk together until smooth. Adjust consistency of sauce to your liking, by adding additional small amounts of water until achieved. 🥣 . Baked Garlic Chili Tofu 1 block extra firm tofu drained and pressed for at least an hour 2 tbsp tamari 1 tbsp nutritional yeast 2 tsp chili garlic sauce . Set oven to 400F. After pressing tofu, cut tofu into even cubes and place in a bowl or Tupperware container. Add remaining ingredients, and if using a bowl just gently toss together. If using a tupperware container, seal container and gently shake contents to evenly coat tofu. Remove tofu and place on a lined baking sheet making sure tofu cubes aren’t touching. Place in oven for at least 25 minutes or until edges have browned. Remove from oven and serve as desired.

Are you a tofu scramble anytime of the day person? 💁🏽‍♀️ I know I M and currently dreaming of the weekend when I had some of this fluffy tofu scramble and avocado toast for a late lunch. 🤤 Honestly, tofu scramble is not just a breakfast option and I’ll gladly have this with a bowl of rice and avocado and call it a day too. 👏🏽 No matter what time tho, having a fluffy go to breakfast scramble is needed. Here’s my take on the classic. 😌 . Fluffy Tofu Scramble 1/2 small onion, diced 1 block firm or extra firm tofu, drained 2 tsp nutritional yeast 1 tsp dry oregano 1/2 tsp dry thyme 1/8 tsp turmeric (if you like turmeric, feel free to add more) 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 tsp garlic chili sauce (or sriracha—optional) 1 heaping tbsp of tahini 1/3 cup unsweetened almond milk Salt and pepper to taste . Heat up a pan to medium heat. If using a normal pan, add a tsp of oil to prevent sticking or use a nonstick pan to do this oil free. Add in onion and sauté until translucent. Crumble tofu with hands into the pan, leave some bigger chunks if desired. Add in soy sauce and all dry spices, herbs and nutritional yeast and stir to combine. Allow everything to cook and become fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Add in tahini, garlic chili sauce and milk. Bring eggs to a low simmer while continuously stirring. Allow tofu to cook and absorb liquid for about 3-5 minutes or until tofu looks fluffy. The tofu should have a slightly runny consistency like eggs tend to have when cooking. Remove from heat and serve tofu as desired. 🥑

Made this yesterday and it was so good. 🙌🏽Made me happy we opted for cooking at home this weekend. Here’s a quick throw together dinner if you need it. 🤗 . Sweet and Sour Chickpeas 1/4 cup water 1 tsp corn starch 1/2 onion, diced 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 inch fresh ginger, minced or 1/2 tsp ginger powder 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained 5 mushrooms, sliced 1 cup broccoli florets 2 tbsp soy sauce 1 tbsp maple syrup or sweetener of choice 1 tsp mustard 1 tbsp ketchup 1 tsp garlic chili sauce 2 tsp vinegar of choice (I used apple cider vinegar) . In a cup prepare corn starch slurry by whisking together corn starch and water until dissolved and then set aside. In a separate cup or bowl add soy sauce, garlic chili sauce, maple syrup, vinegar, ketchup, and mustard and whisk together then set aside. Bring a sauté pan up to medium heat. In a sauté pan add in onion and mushrooms and sauté until onions are softened. Add in broccoli, garlic and ginger and sauté for 30 seconds to a minute until fragrant. Add in chickpeas, stir together to combine, then add in the sauce you whisked together. Stir well and then add in corn starch slurry. Stir and allow to simmer on low until sauce thickens, about 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat, stir well again and serve as desired. 🥣

I’ve been craving oats, and these oats always do it for me. 🥣 Wanted some warm and gooey so topped these oats with some caramelized banana slices. 🍌 You’ll also see some cacao nibs (you can swap with mini chocolate chips), blueberries and pepitas. 🍫 . Vanilla Cardamom Oats 1/2 cup rolled oats 1 tbsp ground flax seed 1/2 tsp cinnamon Pinch of ground cardamom Pinch of nutmeg 1/2 tsp vanilla 1 banana, sliced 1 cup almond milk 🌻 . Add all ingredients to a sauce pan and bring to a simmer. Allow to cook for about 5 minutes to thicken and then remove from the stove top. 🥄 . For the bananas, I sliced half a banana into 1/4 inch slices and place either on a greased pan or good quality non-stick pan and cook for about a minute on low-medium heat without touching. Then add 2 tsp maple syrup, 2 tsp of water, a pinch of cinnamon and pinch of salt. Flip banana slices carefully to cook on the other side for another 1-2 minutes. Top oats with cooked bananas. 🤤

You guys voted and here you have it! 🙌🏽Black Bean Brownies are here! Gluten free, chocolatey and still fudgy. 🤤 Kid tested and approved. More fun details on this recipe are available on the blog. 🍫 . Black Bean Brownies 1/4 cup chocolate chips for melting 1/4 cup natural almond butter 1/2 cup quick oats (use gluten free marked oats to make gluten free) 2 tbsp cocoa powder 1 tsp baking powder 1/4 tsp salt 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained 2 tsp vanilla extract 1/2 cup maple syrup 1/3 cup chocolate chips . Set oven to 350F. In a microwave safe dish, place 1/4 cup chocolate chips and almond butter together and place in microwave for 15 seconds. Stir to combine, and if not fully melted, place back in microwave for an extra 15 seconds until contents mix together smoothly. Place all oats, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt into a food processor. Process on high until oats have turned into a fine flour. At this time, add in chocolate almond butter mixture, maple syrup, black beans, and vanilla extract, to good quality food processor and continue to process until a smooth batter forms. You will likely need to scrap down sides as it processes to make sure batter is evenly mixed and smooth. Add in 1/3 cup chocolate chips and fold them into the batter with a spatula or spoon. Do not process the chocolate chips. Spoon mixture into a lined or greased 8x8 baking pan and spread as evenly as possible around your baking pan. Place tray in the oven and bake brownies for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before cutting.

I made these peanut miso chickpeas earlier this week and got a lot of questions about them. 👌🏽 These chickpeas are so yum, and I’ve been making this creamy bowl at least once a week recently. 🥣 I just posted about them on the blog so if you need to bookmark, feel free to do so (I also really appreciate it as I’ve been putting an effort in uploading them more frequently—you can find a link to them in my profile). 🙃 On to the yum. Recipe below! 📸 . Peanut Miso Chickpeas 1 tsp miso 1/4 cup warm water 1/2 small onion, diced 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms 1 cup broccoli florets 2-3 cloves garlic, minced 1 inch fresh ginger, minced 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 tbsp natural peanut butter, salted 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 tsp garlic chili sauce 1/2 cup vegetable broth or water . Prep all vegetables and aromatics as described in the instructions. In a small bowl, add warm water and miso paste. Mix together with a fork to make sure miso is fully dissolved. Heat a pan to medium heat. Once the pan comes to temperature, add in onion and mushrooms. Allow to sit on the heat for a minute and then move around to saute for about 1-2 minutes until onions are translucent. Add in broccoli florets, and move around in the pan with a small splash of water for about 1-2 minutes. Follow this by adding in garlic and ginger and continuously saute this mixture until garlic and ginger are fragrant, about 1 minute. Add chickpeas, soy sauce, garlic chili sauce, peanut butter and vegetable broth and stir to combine. Allow mixture to come to a simmer and cook for 3 minutes. Add in miso mixture, stir well and allow to cook until broth thickens as desired, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and serve with rice.

Had to have a retake on this miso eggplant because it’s just so good. 🍆 So hopefully you guys don’t mind the little repeat. This was my dinner yesterday. Includes tempeh, the miso eggplant, @lotusfoods forbidden rice noodles, kimchi from @nasoya, avocado, bok choy and some nori flakes. Personally, my fav meal of the week but I always have a bias to miso eggplant. 👏🏽 . Miso Glazed Eggplant 1 medium eggplant, cap removed and cut directly in half lengthwise 2 tbsp soy sauce 1 tsp miso paste 1 tbsp rice wine vinegar 1 1/2 tbsp maple syrup 1 tsp garlic chili sauce or (1 tsp mustard, 1 tsp hot sauce and 1/2 tsp garlic powder) 🥣 . Set oven to 375F. Fill a medium bowl or dish with salted water and submerge both eggplant pieces under water for about 10 minutes. Remove eggplant and score it as desired (I did a cross hatch pattern). Whisk together remaining ingredients until smooth. Brush the surface of the eggplant with the sauce to fully coat the scored side of the eggplant. Take eggplant and place in the oven for 8 minutes. Pull eggplant out and baste again with the miso sauce. Place back in the oven for another 6-8 minutes, baste and cook again for another 4-5 minutes or until middle of eggplant is soft. Remove eggplant from oven, and brush again with remaining sauce. Carefully transfer eggplant to a serving plate and enjoy as desired. You can scoop out the inside with a spoon if you are not a fan of eggplant skin. 🤗

A super fast dinner idea that’s become a staple meal over time. 🔥This cannellini tahini stew is super creamy and rich with flavor. Also happens to be the only way I can convince the hubby to eat cannellini beans. 😂 Paired my stew with some brown rice and broccoli, but you can also stuff this in a sweet potato too. 🍠 Recipe is below, but if you want some more details about making this recipe, you can find it on the blog linked to my profile. 🙃 . CANNELLINI TAHINI STEW 1/2 medium onion, diced 6 baby bella mushrooms, sliced 1 green bell pepper, diced 4 cloves garlic, minced 2 tsp smoked paprika 2 tsp dry basil 1/2 6oz can tomato paste 2 cans cannellini beans, rinsed and drained 3 tbsp tahini 1 cup water or vegetable broth Juice of 1 lemon Salt and pepper to taste . Heat up a non-stick pan to medium heat. Add in onion, pepper and mushrooms along with a pinch of salt. Allow veggetables to sweat untouched for a minute before starting to stir. Stir well and cook until translucent. Add in garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add paprika, basil and tomato paste. Cook mixture for about 2 minutes, stirring well. Stir in cannellini beans to combine in sauce, then add in tahini and water. Stir well and bring to a low simmer. Allow to simmer for about 8-10 minutes, stirring on occassion. Turn off heat and add in lemon juice and stir once more. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.

It’s snack time. 🤗 What have been some of your favorite snacks recently? Made these energy bites yesterday to satisfy my snacking needs. Except...we ate them all already. 😭 Rolled some of them in cocoa powder or matcha powder, so good. Guess it’s time for another batch. 🍫 . Oatmeal Raisin Cookie Bites 1 1/2 cup rolled oats 1/4 cup maple syrup 1 tbsp ground flax seed 1/4 cup natural peanut butter (preferably salted) 1/4 cup raisins 1/2 tsp cinnamon (optional) If coating energy bites Cocoa powder or matcha powder for rolling . Add all ingredients to a food processor and process for about a minute until it forms a moldable dough. Using slightly wet hands, scoop some dough into your hands and form 12 even balls. If coating energy bites, add a little cocoa powder or match powder to a bowl. Take each individual bite and toss around to coat evenly around the ball. Shake off excess. Enjoy as is or store energy bites in a container in the freezer to firm up.

Weekly salad fix and this one was a good one. 🥬🍅Just some massaged kale, lentils, corn, and cherry tomatoes. All topped with some homemade ginger green goddess dressing. Recipe is down below and if you want to bookmark, feel free to check out the recipe on my blog too. 😁 . Ginger Green Goddess Dressing 1 small avocado, pit removed and scoped out of skin 1 tbsp nutritional yeast 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, packed 1 spring onion, roughly chopped 2 cloves garlic 1 inch fresh ginger 1 tbsp yellow mustard 2 tsp maple syrup Juice of 1 lime Zest of 1 lime (optional) Salt to taste 3/4 cup water . Add all ingredients in the order listed to a blender or food processor. Set to blend on high speed until completely smooth. If too thick for your liking, adjust water by adding 2 tbsp at a time to the dressing and blending again. Once dresing is to your liking, pour dressing into a resealable container and place in fridge to completely cool before using. Dressing will keep for 4 days in the refridgerator. 🥬🥗

Happy Monday, friends! 💫 It’s overnight oats season. And as I transition to mostly colder oats, I still like those cooked elements wherever I can stick them. 🍌You can definitely put your oats in the microwave for a minute to warm up, but I’ve become a huge fan of just cooking some fruit and topping the bowl that way. Sweet and delicious. 👏🏽 Here are the oats I’m rocking today. 🥣 . Overnight Oats 1/2 cup rolled oats 1 tbsp chia seeds or ground flax seeds 1 tsp sweetener of your choice or 1 mashed medjool date Pinch of cardamom Pinch of cinnamon Pinch of salt 1 banana 3/4 cup unsweetened plant milk (I used almond milk) . Combine all ingredients together and set overnight in the fridge. You can leave it in a bowl, place in Tupperware container or do whatever fancy thing you like to do with your oats. 🙂 Whenever you are ready to serve, add your banana in and mash lightly into oats. Just top with your favorite fruit and eat it. 👏🏽 . For the apples, dice up an apple and sauté with 2 tsp liquid sweetener and a pinch cinnamon and a splash of water. Allow apples to soften over a low medium heat and then use to top over oatmeal. Added just a little sprinkle of pepitas and cacao nibs for crunch. So good. 🍎

I feel like I had a legit blast from the past this morning. ☀️ Tried recreating a consistent staple meal, which growing up was a plate of mashed plantains and fried salami (salchichón). 🥬 I replaced the salami with breakfast sausage from @gardein. Oddly enough it has such a shockingly close taste to it that my eyes kind of just lit up. It made me want to make this dish so bad. 🤩 . >>> Plantains: Cut off ends of a green plantain and take knife and run along length of skin to open. Use thumb to open seem and pull peel away from the flesh of the plantain. Once skin is removed, cut plantain into quarters and place in boiling salted water for about 8-10 minutes. Plantains will start to turn more yellow in color as they cook. Remove from heat and keep plantains in cooking water until ready to use. You can cut plantain into smaller bite size pieces or mash with a few spoonfuls of cooking water and mash to desired consistency. Top with some sautéed onions. 👌🏽 . >>> Sautéed Kale: Take 5-6 ribs of kale and remove the leaves from stem. Rinse well and squeeze away excess water. With hands, rip into bite size pieces. In a pan, add 3 cloves worth of minced garlic. Sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. Add kale along with 1/2 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tbsp nutritional yeast. Sauté on low medium heat until kale wilts and starts turning a bright green. Kale should be fully cooked in about 5-10 minutes. Remove from stove and set aside. 🥬 . >>> Extra pieces: Cook vegan sausage patty according to instructions. Sauté onion with a lit salt until softened. Cut up some avocado to serve with it. . Assemble and serve your portions and enjoy. 🤗 Also really good if served with tofu scramble. 😍 At some point I will be making my own breakfast sausage to try and mimic this epicness. Work in progress. 👌🏽

I think I like this granola the most when I make it with tahini. 🙇🏽‍♀️I like how it balances out the sweet of the maple. Great on its own, but I always like my granola with a splash of milk and lots of fruit on top. Really refreshing right now and what I’ve been craving since it’s a bit warmer and sunnier outside. 🙃 Today’s combo includes plum (so sweet right now!!), blackberries and banana slices. ☀️Stay safe everyone and have a lovely Saturday! ✨ . Maple Tahini Granola 2 cups rolled oats 1/4 cup tahini (make sure it’s runny, I used @soomfoods) 1/4 cup maple syrup (you can use more if you like your granola more sweet) 1 tsp cinnamon Pinch of nutmeg 2 tsp vanilla extract 1/4 tsp salt or more to taste Optional: add in cacao nibs, pepitas or raisins . Add oats to a large skillet or sauté pan over medium heat. Stir and toast oats for about 1-2 minutes. Add in seasonings and salt and toss to combine then add in remaining ingredients. Lower heat slightly, and continue to stir to prevent granola from burning for about 5-6 minutes. Lower heat again to low and allow to continue toasting while stirring for an additional 3-5 minutes. Granola should have a toasted golden color to them. Remove from heat and allow granola to completely cool before storing. Granola will continue to crisp up as it cools.

👩🏽‍🍳I appreciated all the love and support for the Tempeh Guisado recipe I posted recently, so I combined the flavors from that to make an easier stewed chickpea dish using similar flavors. The combo of sazón, peppers, onions and limes are so delicious. Still dreaming of this. And typically I know a recipe is good when Greg keeps raving about it. 🥣 Let me know if you make it. Have been loving all of your recreations of my recipes. 🥰 . Easy Stewed Chickpeas 2 cans chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1/2 medium onion, finely diced 1/2 green bell pepper, finely diced 1/2 red bell pepper, finely diced 5 cloves garlic, minced 1 tbsp brown sugar or maple syrup (optional) Juice of one lime 1 tbsp tomato paste 2 tbsp low sodium soy sauce 1/2 cup vegetable broth 1 1/2 tsp sazón (I used @eatloisa) 1/2 tsp adobo (I used @eatloisa) 1/2 tsp black pepper 1/2 tsp oregano 3-4 sprigs cilantro, roughly chopped . Add chickpeas to a bowl and add sugar, tomato paste, adobo, sazón, pepper and oregano and top with veggies. Toss to combine and then add lime juice and soy sauce. Gently toss together and allow to sit and marinade for 30 mins. Heat up a pan to medium heat and pour chickpea mixture into the pan. Sauté and allow to cook for about 6-8 minutes while stirring. Add vegetable broth and bring to a low simmer to allow sauce to thicken, about 4-5 minutes. If pan gets dry add a little water. Stir to combine and serve as desired. 🌽

The days and hours bleed together. What time is it? It’s definitely not breakfast. 😂 But it’s probably breakfast time somewhere. And if anything hoping I’m inceptioning your brains to think of the fun oatmeal breakfast you might make yourself tomorrow. 😘 These banana and peanut butter oats won’t disappoint. 🙏🏽 Topped with sautéed apples blackberries, pepitas and a nice dollop of @soomfoods chocolate tahini (my favorite thing right now—you can find a discount for it in my profile). I’m gonna snag a bowl of this for a late lunch and enjoy myself now. 🙃 . Banana Peanut Butter Oats 1/3 cup rolled oats 1 tbsp ground flaxseed 1 sliced banana or replace with 2 tsp sweetener 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice or cinnamon 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 1 tbsp peanut butter Salt to taste . Add all ingredients to sauce pan, stir to combine and allow to cook and thicken for 5 minutes. I sautéed some diced apples until they were softened in cinnamon, 2 tsp maple syrup and a pinch of salt then added on top of the oats. 😛 . For the apples, just chop one apple into cubes. Place in a pan with 2 tsp maple syrup, pinch of salt and pinch of cinnamon. Stir and sauté on low heat until maple syrup coats apples and apples slightly soften and brown. 🍎

Had a lot of extra lentils and they kind of dried out a bit. 🍛So to save them, just threw them into this sauté mix and man was it tasty. Smoked paprika makes everything super yummy. 🥣 Was so happy to get a new bottle of it recently. 🙌 . 1 cup cauliflower florets 1 1/2 cups cooked lentils 2 tsp smoked paprika Pinch of turmeric 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 inch fresh ginger, minced 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 small onion, diced 1 green belle pepper, diced 1 jalapeño, diced 1 tbsp brown sugar 1 tbsp tomato paste 1 cup sliced mushrooms 1 cup water or veggie broth . Add onion, mushrooms, bell pepper, and jalapeño and sauté for about 3-4 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant. Add tomato paste, cauliflower, lentils, soy sauce, and remaining seasonings. Sauté for about 2-3 minutes. Add sugar and water and bring to a simmer. Stir and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and then serve. (Makes about 2-3 servings).

It’s only Tuesday, but this week has been an excellent week for food. 👏🏽 Today, we are bringing back my miso glazed eggplant. It is sooooo good, so if you have some eggplant on hand, highly recommend this. 😁 . Miso Glazed Eggplant 1 medium eggplant, cap removed and cut directly in half lengthwise 2 tbsp soy sauce 1 tsp miso paste 1 tbsp rice wine vinegar 1 1/2 tbsp maple syrup 1 tsp garlic chili sauce or (1 tsp mustard, 1 tsp hot sauce and 1/2 tsp garlic powder) 🥣 . Set oven to 375F. Fill a medium bowl or dish with salted water and submerge both eggplant pieces under water for about 10 minutes. Remove eggplant and score it as desired (I did a cross hatch pattern). Whisk together remaining ingredients until smooth. Brush the surface of the eggplant with the sauce to fully coat the scored side of the eggplant. Take eggplant and place in the oven for 8 minutes. Pull eggplant out and baste again with the miso sauce. Place back in the oven for another 6-8 minutes, baste and cook again for another 4-5 minutes or until middle of eggplant is soft. Remove eggplant from oven, and brush again with remaining sauce. Carefully transfer eggplant to a serving plate and enjoy as desired. You can scoop out the inside with a spoon if you are not a fan of eggplant skin. 🤗

Happy Monday! 🌈Wanted something close to cereal this morning, so enjoyed some homemade granola on the stove top. Really easy to put together and so good with some milk and fresh fruit on top. 🤤 . Cinnamon Peanut Butter Granola 2 cups rolled oats 1/4 cup peanut butter (make sure it’s runny) 1/4 cup maple syrup (you can use more if you like your granola more sweet) 1 tsp cinnamon 2 tsp vanilla extract 1/4 tsp salt or more to taste Optional: add in cacao nibs, pepitas or raisins . Add oats to a large skillet or sauté pan over medium heat. Stir and toast oats for about 1-2 minutes. Add in seasonings and salt and toss to combine then add in remaining ingredients. Lower heat slightly, and continue to stir to prevent granola from burning for about 5-6 minutes. Lower heat again to low and allow to continue toasting while stirring for an additional 3-5 minutes. Granola should have a toasted golden color to them. Remove from heat and allow granola to completely cool before storing. Granola will continue to crisp up as it cools. But also really good hot off the stove too.

I kept telling Greg I would make these pizza pinwheels one day, so I did about 2 weekends ago. 🍕And he’s been all about them ever since. Literally he asks me to make them twice every weekend. 😂 The first time I made these, I thought they would be a flop because we had no yeast to make dough. Whelp, didn’t seem to be a problem! 💯 . These pinwheels are pretty simple and very easy to modify. I used some meatless meatballs for these, made my own pizza sauce with tomato paste, and topped with some vegan cheese. If you swipe to the last photo, I actually made a version today that was stuffed with lentils, kale and vegan cheese. For full details for how to make the dough and sauce, it’s in my latest blog post. 💻 . Pizza Pinwheels 1 pizza dough (made my own, no yeast needed) 1/3 cup pizza sauce (I made my own) 6 frozen meatballs (I used Gardein) 1/2 cup shredded vegan cheese . Set oven to 375F. Prepare meatballs according to the package and then chop into small pieces. Taking your pizza dough, place dough on a smooth surface and flatten dough with a rolling pin to form a thin rectangular dough. Evenly, spread pizza sauce over the top of the flattened dough. Sprinkle meatballs and cheese evenly over top of the dough. Starting at one end of the long side of the dough, carefully start pinching and rolling dough into a tight log like you would a cinnamon roll. Once fully rolled, cut the roll into 6 equal pizza rolls. Place rolls in rows of two in a bread pan. Place pan into the oven for 20 minutes. Remove pan from oven and sprinkle an additional handful of cheese over top. Place pan back into the oven for another 5 minutes to allow cheese to melt. Remove pan from oven and allow to set for 5 minutes. Cut pieces out to serve with extra pizza sauce.

Condolences to all of you who have had a disappointing salad in the past. 🥺No one should ever have to go through that and this is why I wrote a post all about it on the blog. 🥗 Full break down of how to make a yummy salad, which includes this beauty I enjoyed for lunch the other day. It includes baked tempeh, baked purple potatoes, massages kale, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers and the most amazing chili lime tahini dressing. This is definitely a salad I will likely remake again and again because it was that yummy. 🤤 All details included on the blog. . Chili Lime Tahini Dressing 2 tbsp tahini (I used @soomfoods) 1/2 tsp chili lime seasoning 2 tsp maple syrup Juice of 1 lime 1/2 tbsp nutritional yeast 2-3 tbsp water . In a bowl, combine all ingredients and whisk to fully combine until smooth. Adjust water until you achieve your desired consistency. 🥣 . To assemble your salad, take 2 tbsp of dressing and add to some de stemmed kale and massage dressing into greens. Massage greens until leaves are bright green and have shrunken in size, about 2-3 minutes. Top kale with some plant protein (I used tempeh), extra veggies, some starch (I used a small roasted potato, but grains lime quinoa and rice work too), cilantro, and top with dressing. You can add other items too like different nuts and seeds for more crunch. I ran out of a few toppings, but this salad was still super filling and satisfying. 🥗

Pasta Friday, we meet again. 🙇🏽‍♀️ Not even mad because this pasta was yummy. Instead of using a bean based pasta, just added white beans to it. Both the pasta and beans are covered in a spicy red sauce. 💁🏽‍♀️ . Pasta with Spicy Red Sauce 2 cups cooked/canned white beans, rinsed and drained 1 6oz can of tomato paste 1/2 an onion, diced 3 garlic cloves, minced 1 tbsp white balsamic vinegar 1 tsp dry basil 1/2 tsp dry oregano 1 tsp smoked paprika 1/2 to 1 tsp crushed red pepper 1 tbsp nutritional yeast 2 tsp brown sugar 1 cup vegetable broth 4 servings pasta 1/2 cup pasta water 1/4 tsp salt . In a sauce pan, add onion and sauté u TIL translucent. Add in garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add in tomato paste, oregano, basil and smoked paprika and stir while cooking for about 1-2 minutes. Add in white beans, sugar and broth and allow to cook and thicken for about 5 minutes on low medium heat. Add in balsamic vinegar and nutritional yeast and stir to combine. Allow to sit on low heat while you prepare the pasta (at this time you can also add greens like spinach in to wilt). Prepare pasta according to package. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water prior to draining pasta. Once pasta is drained add pasta to the sauce along with pasta water and salt. Stir to combine and allow to thicken, about 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat and serve. 🥣

Had a little too much fun with colors at the moment. 🌈 Flavored my rice as it cooked with some adobo seasoning and a pinch of turmeric—now it’s bright yellow. Got some purple brussel sprouts and they remained so lovely and purple while they cooked. 💜And the star of my plate was this chili lime tofu. 🙌🏽 . Chili Lime Tofu 1 block extra firm tofu 2 tbsp soy sauce 1/2 tsp chili powder Pinch of garlic powder Zest of one lime Juice of 1/2 a lime Pinch of salt 1 tsp nutritional yeast 1 tsp maple syrup . Preheat oven to 400F. Remove block of tofu from packaging. Drain and press excess liquid with either a tofu press or wrap tofu in a few paper towels and place a heavy object over top to remove excess. Once tofu is drained, chop tofu into cubes and set aside. Whisk together remaining ingredients in a Tupperware container. Add tofu, seal container and shake together. Feel free to bake right away or marinade for an hour before baking. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until edges of tofu start to crisp up. Serve and enjoy. 💯

Sweet or savory snacks? 🤔 Snacking has inevitably been coming up a lot during sessions I’ve had with people. My favorite snack right now is apple slices with peanut butter, but for many sometimes that doesn’t cut it. Here’s a quick and fun snack idea you can customize to your preference. A fruit roll up if you will. 🤣 . Fruit Roll Up 1 whole grain wrap 1 serving of fruit of choice 1 tbsp peanut butter Add Ins: chopped nuts, seeds, date syrup, chocolate chips, granola, etc. . Take your wrap and spread with peanut butter. Add fruit towards one end of the wrap plus any extra bits like nuts, seeds, or granola and roll it like you would a sushi roll. Eat as is or cut into individual pieces to enjoy. 🍌 . You can also do the same with some savory options. Spread hummus on a wrap and load up with greens, avocado, tofu, and rolls up. 🙌🏽

I know most people have taken on bread making, but ever think to make your own tortillas? 🌮 This taco Tuesday is a special one considering its Cinco de Mayo. It only seemed appropriate that I try to make everything from scratch. It’s what I deserve. 🤣 And making it wasn’t really hard either. I know a lot of people might not be into making their own tortillas from scratch, but making sure you load up your tacos right is a must. 🌮 . Favorite taco filling at the moment are some black beans, corn, tomato, avocado, romaine, chili lime seasoning and some lime juice. 🤤You can find my super easy bean recipe below. ❤️ . Seasoned black beans 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained 1/2 tbsp soy sauce 1 tbsp minced garlic 1/2 tsp adobo seasoning Pinch of onion powder 2 tbsp water 1 tbsp favorite hot sauce or bbq sauce🌶 . Add black beans, seasonings and water to a pan and set to low heat. When beans are heated through and most of the water is gone, turn off heat and coat beans with hot sauce. 😁

Just had the leftovers for this bowl and it’s just as good if not better. 😋I’m such a huge fan of lentils. From their nutrition to how quick they cook, I can’t get enough. 🙌 These lentils are seasoned with adobo. Can’t help it. Adobo makes everything taste really good. 😆 Served this with rice, corn, avocado and a squeeze of lime. Not pictured was the broccoli I made, but had a bowl of that to the side. 🥦 . Adobo Lentils 1 cup dry green lentils 1 small potato, diced (optional) 1 small onion, diced 1 tsp adobo seasoning or to taste 1 tsp cumin 1 tsp smoked paprika 2 tsp oregano 3 cups vegetable broth 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 bell pepper or roasted bell pepper, diced Bunch of cilantro with stems, roughly chopped . Sauté onions until softened in a large sauce pan. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add spices, potatoes, bell pepper, and lentils and stir well for at least 1 minute. Add in broth, stir and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover with a lid and allow lentils to cook for at least 30 minutes or when lentils are tender. Remove lid and stir in cilantro. Serve with rice. 🍚

New mug cake, but now in the form of cinnamon rolls. 😋 Much faster than traditional rolls and cooks in the microwave in about a minute. 🥣 Note, these are fun and not meant to taste as decadent as a real Cinnabon, but still yum! Have not tested with other flours so please note if you change too much they will likely not be the same. . Cinnamon Roll Mug Cake . Dough>> 4 tbsp spelt flour or regular flour 1 3/4 tbsp unsweetened almond milk Pinch of salt Pinch of cinnamon 1/2 tsp brown sugar (optional) 1/2 tsp baking powder . Filling>> 1 tsp maple syrup or vegan butter 2 tsp brown sugar Pinch of cinnamon Pinch of salt . Glaze (optional)>> If you want a traditional icing, just mix 1 tbsp powdered sugar with a splash of almond milk. Mix until the right consistency is achieved. . Dough & Filling>> In a bowl, add flour, cinnamon, baking powder, salt, and sugar and mix well. Add in milk and mix together with a fork until a dough starts to form. Go in with your hands and kneed dough for about 1-2 minutes. If dough is dry, add a small splash of milk. If dough is too wet, add a pinch of flour until it is less sticky. Knees for 1 minute and allow dough to rest for a minute, then take dough to a lightly floured surface and with hands start flattening dough and forming a rectangle. Using either maple syrup or vegan butter, lightly spread it over the dough surface then sprinkle brown sugar and cinnamon over top. With a spoon, make sure to spread cinnamon sugar mixture evenly over the dough. Starting from the short end of the dough, start rolling dough tightly to form a log. Cut log into 4 even pieces. Take cinnamon roll pieces and place them in a shallow mug, allowing a little space in between for them to grow. Place mug in the microwave and set to 1 minute. Allow to cook for the first 30 second and open microwave door to allow to rest for a second. Close door again and microwave for the remaining 30 seconds. Allow to rest for a few seconds and then cook for the remaining 15 seconds if buns do not appear done cooking. Once mug cake is cooked, top with icing and enjoy immediately. If you allow the mug cake to sit for a long time, it will eventually get hard.

Because whenever I can get my hands on some fresh greens I take advantage of them with pleasure. 🙃 Was really happy to have some kale and cauliflower. Luckily, they are a little tougher, so I can count on them staying fresh for a while...not that I ever have a problem eating my way through all the veg before it goes bad anyway. 😂 . This bowl of rice topped with some sautéed garlicky chickpeas and kale was a winner. Threw in some roasted cauliflower and now this plate sits happily in my belly. 😋 . Garlicky Chickpeas and Kale 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1/2 small onion, diced 1 inch ginger, minced 3 cloves fresh garlic, minced 1/2 tsp garlic powder 1 tsp garlic chili sauce 1/4 cup water 1/2 tbsp soy sauce Pinch of salt 1 bunch kale, leaves removed from stems and roughly chopped . In a pan sauté onion with a pinch of salt. Allow to soften then add in ginger and minced garlic. Allow to sauté for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add in chickpeas, garlic chili sauce, water, soy sauce and garlic powder and stir to combine. Add in kale and stir again. Lower heat to low and place a lid on top. Cover and allow to steam for 2-4 minutes. Remove lid when leaves have wilted and stir to combine once more allowing any remaining water to cook off. Stir in any extras. To this I added some roasted cauliflower and some minced green onion. 🙌 . Serve with rice and a tahini dressing on top. Just add 1 tbsp tahini, juice of half a lemon, 1/4 tsp garlic powder, pinch of salt and 1-2 tbsp water. Whisk until smooth and pour over top. 🍚

Needed a little bit of a breather today, so instead of making my oats from scratch. 🥣 I decided to use one of the yummy overnight oats that I was gifted from @mush. This was their blueberry one, which is my favorite. 💯 I just mashed a banana and added 1 tbsp of hemp hearts into it for more sweetness and some omegas, and just had some fun designing and topping my bowl with fruit I got from a produce box I buy weekly. Was able to top with extra banana slices, blueberries, mango and hemp hearts. 😌 . If you need a moment, just take it. You’ll be glad you did. Besides, it’s Friday, I think a lot of us need a mental break. It’s okay to not be 100% everyday. ❤️

April’s done already? That went fast. 🙃Kind of shocked tomorrow is May. Going to enjoy the rest of today in peace with this Curry Peanut Noodle bowl. 😋 I love peanut sauce and it’s been a while since I’ve made it. Had some extra Thai green curry paste and decided to add this to the sauce base and it is really yummy. Totally okay to leave out, but definitely adds a yummy flavor twist to this sauce. 🙂 . Curry Peanut Sauce 1/4 cup peanut butter 3 tbsp gluten free soy sauce 2 tsp garlic chili sauce 1 tbsp maple syrup or brown sugar 1 tsp Thai curry paste (I used a green curry paste—still tasty without this but love the addition in this sauce) 1/2 tsp ground ginger 1/2 tsp pepper flakes 1/4 cup water . In a bowl whisk all ingredients together until smooth. If sauce is too thick, add a splash of water and whisk until consistency is a little thinner to your liking. . Noodle Prep: Stir fry veggies of choice until tender. Add cooked noodles plus 1/4 cup of the peanut sauce. Stir to combine and remove from heat. Serve immediately and top with sesame seeds, baked tofu and green onion. 🙌🏽

This rice came out so good. 💯 Inspired by my mom’s arroz con gandules. Not exactly the same because it always tastes best with white rice, but still results in some bomb tasting rice. 🙌🏽 Down the road I want to revisit this and make with white rice. 🍚Currently out, but this brown rice has come out better this batch than any other time I’ve attempted something similar. 🙂 . 1 1/2 cups brown jasmine rice (I used @lotusfoods) 2 1/2 cups vegetable broth 1/2 small onion, finely diced 1 tbsp of tomato paste 1 celery stock, minced 1/2 green bell pepper, diced 4 cloves garlic, minced 1/2 tsp oregano 1/4 tsp black pepper 2 tsp sazon 1/2 tsp smoked paprika 1/2 tsp adobo seasoning 1 can gandules or lentils, drained 1 handful of cilantro (optional if you don’t like the taste of it) . Start by sautéing onions, celery and green bell pepper together in a medium pot until softened. Add in garlic and spices and continue to sauté until fragrant. Next, add tomato paste along with the gandules and stir to evenly distribute. As you sauté, the tomato paste will start to turn a deeper red. Add in veggie broth, stir and bring to a boil. Once at a boil, add in rice. Allow to boil for 10 minutes then lower to a simmer and cover with a lid for an additional 10 minutes. If using a glass lid, check to see if most of liquid looks like it is gone at this point. Uncover lid and stir to avoid clumping on the bottom. Add cilantro and cover with lid again, lower to the lowest heat setting and allow to cook for 25 minutes covered (DO NOT REMOVE LID UNTIL COOKING TIME IS DONE). Remove lid and stir to fluff the rice. Adjust salt to taste and serve as desired. Paired this with broccoli, seitan and some avocado. 🥑

Grateful to all the root veggies and chickpeas I had waiting for me in the fridge! 🙌🏽 Had some roasted beets on hand and for some reason was really craving it. Paired nicely with some carrots and mushrooms. Topped with tahini dressing (just a spoonful of tahini with juice of half a lemon, salt and garlic powder to taste). . Smoky Sweet Sautéed Chickpeas 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 small red onion, diced 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms 1/2 tsp smoked paprika 1/2 tsp garlic powder 1/2 tsp thyme 2 tsp tamari or regular soy sauce 2 tsp liquid sweetener like maple syrup Salt & Pepper to taste Veggies of choice: I used one small diced roasted beet and a small diced carrot 🙌🏽 . Add mushrooms and onions to a sauté pan and allow to cook and brown to soften, about 3 minutes. Add in chickpeas, carrots and beets and seasonings. Sauté, allowing carrots to cook for at least 3 minutes. Add tamari and maple syrup. Sauté together allowing flavor to infuse into the chickpeas and veggies. Once liquid has cooked off, about 3-4 minutes and veggies look evenly coated and caramelized, remove from heat. Serve immediately with rice and some dressing! 💯

Happy Monday! 🌞Just starting my week out with some much needed oatmeal. I soaked a tea bag (chai flavored), into my oats as they were cooking this morning. Smells and tastes so good. 🥣 . Chai Tea Oats 1/3 cup rolled oats (feel free to use more as desired) 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 1/2 tsp chia seeds 2 tsp maple syrup 1 tea chai tea bag Splash of vanilla (optional) Pinch of salt . Add oats, milk, chia seeds and vanilla in a sauce pan and stir together. Add tea bag and bring oats up to a low simmer. Allow to cook and thicken for about 5-8 minutes. Remove tea bag and squeeze any excess into the pot then discard. Add a pinch of salt and stir oats to combine. Serve and enjoy. 🙂

If you need a customizable lunch prep idea for the week ahead, start off by roasting a few sweet potatoes 🍠 until they are fully cooked and gooey soft, about 45-55 minutes in the oven for small to medium potatoes at 400F (make sure to poke some holes in them before baking). 🥑 Once they are baked they become the perfect vehicle for all the toppings. Sweet or savory, they can go in either direction. This is one variation I absolutely love. Just top with these buffalo black beans and add some guac and sliced tomatoes. Be creative and make them your own. 😋 . Buffalo Black Beans (serves 2-3) 1 can of black beans (if you want them saucy, do not drain can) 2 tbsp buffalo sauce (I used Frank’s Red Hot) 1 tsp garlic chili sauce 2 tsp maple syrup . In a pan add all ingredients and bring to a low simmer. Stir continuously until sauce starts to thicken to desired consistency. About 5-10 minutes after simmering. Remove from heat and serve. 🍛

Growing up, Pollo Guisado was a Dominican dish I had quite often. 🙆🏽‍♀️For those that don’t know, that is the equivalent of stewed chicken. Obviously, I don’t eat chicken anymore. 🙅🏽‍♀️ And in a desire to recreate the flavors I remember loving, I opted for using tempeh in place of chicken. You can also use vegan “chicken” if you aren’t a fan of tempeh. 🍚 Delicious deep flavors and it becomes more flavorful the longer it sits. 💯 . Tempeh Guisado 1 block of tempeh (if not a fan of tempeh, feel free to use some mock meats as a replacement), cut into strips 1/2 onion, finely diced 1/2 green bell pepper, finely diced 1/2 red bell pepper, finely diced 1 stalk of celery, finely diced 5 cloves garlic, minced 1 tbsp brown sugar or maple syrup (optional) Juice of one lime 1 tbsp tomato paste 2 tbsp low sodium soy sauce 1 1/2 cups vegetable broth 1 1/2 tsp sazón (I used @eatloisa) 1/2 tsp adobo (I used @eatloisa) 1/2 tsp black pepper 1/2 tsp oregano 2 tsp olive oil 1 tsp vinegar 3-4 sprigs cilantro, roughly chopped . Optional, but recommended, steam tempeh for 10 minutes to cut bitterness. Remove and allow to cool. Place tempeh in a bowl and add sugar, adobo, sazón, pepper and oregano and top with veggies. Add lime juice and soy sauce. Gently toss together and allow to sit and marinade for 30-45 mins. Heat up a pan to medium heat and add oil. Scoop tempeh out of marinade and add to pan. Carefully sauté and brown both sides. While tempeh is cooking, add tomato paste to remaining marinade and stir together. Add the marinade to the pan with the tempeh and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add vegetable broth and bring mixture to a boil then reduce to a simmer. Allow to cook and simmer on low for 30 minutes. Of pan gets dry add a little water. Once tempeh is cooked, add vinegar and turn off heat. Stir to combine and serve as desired. You can serve this with rice and avocado. So delicious. 😋

It’s been a while since I had a good ramen bowl. This one was definitely top tier. 💯The broth is easy to make and it paired with these @lotusfoods rice noodles, cauliflower, edamame and corn perfectly. 🥰 . Tahini Miso Broth 1 tbsp tahini 2 cups veggie broth 1 tsp miso 1 tbsp soy sauce 1/2 tsp garlic chili sauce . In a bowl, add tahini and miso and mix well. Add in water slowly and whisk to combine, making sure there are no lumps. Add remaining ingredients and pour into a sauce pan to heat on low. When noodles are done cooking, add noodles to broth and serve in a bowl. Add other toppings as desired. 🙂

Surprisingly, I feel like the days have been so busy. 🌱 Luckily overnight oats have been saving the day for me. This bowl was especially good. Topped it with some caramelized bananas, peanut butter and some frozen blueberries. 😋 . Overnight Oats 1/2 cup rolled oats 1 tbsp chia seeds Pinch cinnamon Pinch cardamom Pinch salt 1/2 mashed banana (other half for topping) 3/4 cup almond milk 🥛 . Combine ingredients (except banana) in a bowl or Tupperware. Stir and set in fridge. Add mashed banana prior to serving and serve topped with fruit. 🙂

Happy Earth Day. 🌍Whatever small steps you can take towards success, focus on that. I know it’s easy to feel you need to do it all or it’s not worth the effort, but every little thing is vital. 🌱 . Enjoyed a plate of green tea buckwheat noodles we had in the pantry and paired it with some tempeh, green peppers and greens. The tempeh was extra bomb. 🔥 . Sweet Chili Tempeh (makes 2 servings) 1 cup veggie broth or water with 1/2 a bouillon cube) 1 block tempeh, cut into pieces 1 tbsp soy sauce 1 tsp minced garlic 2 tbsp sweet chili sauce . In a pan add all ingredients except tempeh and bring to a simmer. Cover with lid and allow to cook for about 5 minutes. Remove lid and allow liquid to absorb into the tempeh and cook off. Once liquid is absorbed, allow tempeh to lightly brown before removing from pan. Enjoy with noodles or any other sides you prefer. 🍜

Kind of did a spin off of my banana bread and made some double chocolate chip banana muffins. 🍫 These also happen to be gluten free. Just used oats, no other fancy flours required. 😌 A fun breakfast alternative if you need your chocolate fix. 🌻 . Double Chocolate Chip Banana Muffins 2 cups rolled oats 1/3 cup natural nut butter (I used peanut butter) 1/3 cup maple syrup 3 ripe bananas 1/3 cup unsweetened almond milk 2/3 cup dark cocoa powder 1/2 cup chocolate chips 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar 1 tbsp ground flax seed 2 tbsp water 1/2 tsp salt 1 tsp baking soda 2 tsp baking powder . Preheat oven to 350F. In a mixing bowl add flaxseed and water. Stir to combine and allow to rest for 3 minutes while you make oat flour. Add oats to a blender and blend on high until oats turn into a flour then set aside. Add bananas to flax mixture and mash until smooth using a fork or whisk. Whisk in baking soda, baking powder, almond milk, maple syrup, nut butter, and salt. Once combined, add apple cider vinegar and whisk to combine. You should see mixture lighten a little in color and fluff up. Add flour and cocoa powder and gently mix together to form a thick batter. Fold in chocolate chips and then evenly distribute batter into a muffin tin. Should make 12 muffins. Place muffins in oven and bake for 20 minutes. Allow to completely cool before removing from the muffin tin. 🧁

Happy Monday everyone! 🥳 Wanted to go back to a recipe I really enjoyed over the winter. I always have miso paste on hand and luckily I don’t have to worry about this going bad anytime soon. 😌 This was particularly a great lunch and reheated nicely. So yum! Had some almond miso chickpeas with @lotusfoods Forbidden Rice and some pickled cabbage. 😋 . Spicy Almond Miso Chickpeas (bottom container) 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms 1/2 small red onion, diced 2-3 cloves garlic, minced 1 inch fresh ginger, minced 1 tsp garlic chili sauce 1 tsp miso + 1/4 cup warm water 1 tbsp low sodium soy sauce 1 tbsp almond butter 1/2 cup veggie broth or water . In a small bowl, add warm water and miso paste. Mix together with a fork to make sure miso is dissolved. In a pan, sauté onions and mushrooms until softened. Add in garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant. Add chickpeas, soy sauce, garlic chili sauce, veggie broth, and sauce to fully combine. Allow to simmer and add in almond butter and miso mixture. Allow to thicken and absorb liquid. Enjoy!

I’m always down for pancakes on the weekend. 🥞Especially if they are golden and fluffy. 😛 Here’s a fun variation of my fluffy whole grain pancakes that use cornmeal. I made using some cornmeal flour. And oh goodness it was so good. Used some fresh strawberries I had gotten from our produce box. Some were starting to go (was trying to conserve for the whole week this was the last of them) so I tossed them in a sweet balsamic sauce to top the pancakes. 🍓 . Major props for my hubby helping with different shots. 🤣🤣 Now that we are home together all the time he has become my photography assistant. Today he helped with the pour shot of maple syrup. 🙂 . Cornmeal Pancakes 1 ripe banana 1 tbsp ground flax seeds 2 tbsp water 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar 1/2 tsp vanilla extract 1/4 tsp salt 2 tsp baking powder 1 tsp baking soda 1 tbsp sugar or maple syrup 1 cup white whole wheat flour 1/2 cup corn meal 1 1/2 cups non-dairy milk 1 tsp cinnamon . Preheat a griddle or pan. In a mixing bowl, add banana and with a whisk or fork mash banana until mostly smooth. Add in flax seed and water and give mixture a good stir and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Next add in apple cider vinegar, vanilla, salt, and sugar and mix this in well. Add in baking soda and baking powder. Stir well again and you will notice the mixture react and start to fluff up. Add in flour, cinnamon and milk and mix to form a thick batter (avoid over mixing). When griddle is ready, scoop 1/4 cup of pancake batter onto griddle surface. Avoid spreading out too thin and cook for 2-3 minutes or until bottom of pancake is golden. Flip and cook other side for 2-3 minutes as well. Repeat using remain pancake batter. Remove from heat and eat. 🥞 . BONUS: Sweet Balsamic Strawberries 1/2 cup sliced strawberries 3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar 2-3 tbsp of sugar/maple syrup Pinch of cinnamon . In a bowl combine sweetener and balsamic vinegar. Mix well together to dissolve appropriately. Add in strawberries and cinnamon and toss to coat. Adjust sweetness to your preference. Refrigerate until ready for use. Use to top pancakes.

Happy Saturday! ❄️We got an unexpected round of snow last night. Having curry right now just seems like the best idea. 😛 This coconut mango chickpea curry uses all of my favorite ingredients all tied into a really satisfying and warming dish. 🥥Serve with some greens and brown rice for a complete meal. 🍛 . Coconut Mango Chickpea Curry 2 cans chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 small onion, diced 4 garlic cloves, minced 1 inch ginger, peeled and minced 1 cup thawed frozen mango or 1 fresh mango, diced Juice and zest of 1 lime 2 cans lite coconut milk or 3 cups unsweetened oatmilk 1 tsp Garam Masala 1 tbsp curry powder 1/4 tsp turmeric 1 tbsp tomato paste 2 cups chopped cauliflower florets 1 tbsp chickpea flour Salt to taste . In a large sauce pan or pot, add onion and sauté until softened. Add in ginger, garlic, tomato paste, turmeric, curry powder and Garam masala. Stir and sauté for a minute or until fragrant. Add in cauliflower and a splash of milk and sauté an extra minute. Add chickpeas, chickpea flour, and remainder of milk. Stir together and bring to a simmer. Simmer on low heat for 10 minutes. Add in mango, stir and cook for another 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add the lime juice and zest. Stir, add salt to taste and serve. 🥭

I have a little preview of this bowl yesterday. 🍓And it’s still been on my mind. Got a pint of strawberries and was so excited to start using them for breakfast. This oatmeal is flavored with cinnamon and strawberries. Nice and fresh as a mark for the spring season. So good. 🤤 . Strawberry Oats 1/3 cup rolled oats 1/2 tbsp chia seeds 1 tbsp hemp hearts 1 1/4 cup almond milk 3 strawberries, diced 2 tbsp yogurt (I used coconut yogurt from @culinayogurt) 2 tsp maple syrup 1/4 tsp cinnamon Pinch of salt . Add oats, chia, hemp hearts, cinnamon, and strawberries, and milk to a saucepan. Bring to a simmer and allow to cook and thicken for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in maple syrup, salt and yogurt. Top bowl with additional fresh strawberries, more yogurt and an extra drizzle of maple syrup if desired. 😊

Was really happy to get a restock on some food this week. 🌱 I’ve been missing my typical veggies, but had some tofu and some carrots and cabbage left over so wanted a sushi bowl. 🥕Paired this with some rice, avocado and cucumber we recently stock up from thanks to @imperfectfoods. I quick pickled the cabbage in some apple cider vinegar, salt and a little sugar. 🥣 . For the tofu, just set your oven to 400F. Cube up your tofu (make sure you drain and press out some of the water) and place in a baggie or Tupperware container. I added 2 tbsp soy sauce and 2 tbsp sweet chili sauce and just tossed to coat. Place your tofu spread out on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. It was so good. Feel free to marinate for longer if you have the time. 🍚

A day ago, I was down to the bare minimum pantry wise. 🍚 Had some rice, a sad looking bunch of broccoli, a bell pepper, onion and chickpeas. Had to make it work with the condiments I had on hand. 😅 Luckily, it was delicious! And wanted to share it with you in case you need a quick meal idea. Nice and hearty and feel free to swap out with things like white beans or tofu if you’re tired of chickpeas! 🙂 . Garlic Chili Chickpeas 2 cans chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 small onion, diced 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 tbsp garlic chili sauce 1 15oz can of crushed tomatoes 2 tsp smoked paprika 1 bay leaf 1 jalapeno, diced or 1/8 tsp cayenne pepper 1 green bell pepper, diced 1 tbsp soy sauce or coconut aminos 1 cup veggie broth 1 tbsp chickpea flour or regular flour 2 tsp sugar . In a cup, whisk together flour and veggie broth then set aside. In a large sauce pan, add onion and sauté until translucent. Add in peppers and garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add in tomatoes, paprika and soy sauce and stir together. Allow to cook for 1-2 minutes. Add in broth mixture and remaining ingredients into the pan and stir to combine. Allow to simmer on a low heat for at least 20 minutes. Remove bay leaf, stir well then serve. . Overtop just made a quick tahini dressing with lemon juice, tahini, garlic powder and water.

Happy #toasttuesday! 🍞My morning is looking like fresh bread smeared with hummus and topped with some sautéed mushrooms. . Mushrooms: sauté some sliced mushrooms with a tbsp of some vegan pesto . Toast: Take a slice of your favorite bread and smear with 2 tbsp hummus, then place bread in toaster oven to heat the bread and hummus. (I had a plate of warm hummus and mushrooms a long time ago at a middle eastern restaurant and that’s the way I always want my hummus now lol). . Assemble: Top your toast with mushrooms. Feel free to add extras. I went with everything but the bagel seasoning and some cilantro. Hot sauce or a balsamic glaze works too! 😋

It’s hard to keep up with everything at the moment. 😅 But when I have my wits about me, I generally succeed. I’ll count this falafel bowl a success. One of our produce boxes came with lots of extra cilantro and parsley. So couldn’t pass up the chance to make these. 🧆 . Falafel 1 can of Chickpeas, rinse and drained (pat dry with a towel) 2 tsp cumin 3 tbsp rolled/quick oats 1/4 medium onion, diced 1 handful of cilantro, tough stems removed 1 handful fresh parsley, tough stems removed 2 tsp minced garlic 1/4 tsp salt 🥙 Optional but totally worth adding: 1 tsp smoked paprika and 1 jalapeño (you can make these with an extra spanish flare and add 1 tsp sazón) . Take all ingredients and add to a food processor (I used my cheap tiny food processor which is much easier to clean). Process the ingredients together until mixture is slightly crumbly, but sticks together very well (if you can’t form a ball without it falling a part then you should process it a little more. Take a small spoon full of the mixture and roll between your hands to make even looking falafel balls (should make 12). You can cook the falafel in a preheated oven set at 400F for 25 minutes on one side then flip (please do it with a spatula to prevent the falafel from getting stuck and ripping) and bake for another 5 minutes or until golden. If using your airfrier, set temperature to 370 and allow falafel to cook for 9 minutes. Serve as desired. 🥒 Feel free to double recipe for more falafel. 💚

Before all the craziness, Greg’s boss was super kind and gave us some dry black beans to cook with (we were told these were a special Brazilian variety). Definitely subtle differences from the normal variety we are used to, so I was happy to experiment with them in a new recipe. It’s also been a while since I made fresh black beans from dry beans, and it’s definitely worth the time. Mind you, you can make this recipe using normal dry black beans. Should still come out super yummy, and still perfect to pair with some rice. 🍚 Notes for this recipe: you can cook this in the instant pot or on the stovetop. Instant pot is less involved, which I always prefer. But instructions for both methods are available below. 🥣 . Garlic Herb Black Bean Stew . For the black beans 2 cups or 1 lb dry black beans 2 bay leaves 1 medium onion diced 1 tbsp smoked paprika Salt to taste . Garlic Herb Mince 1 cup packed fresh parsley with stems 4 large cloves garlic, minced or 2 tbsp jarred minced garlic 1 tsp miso paste (optional, but gives a nice umami flavor) 2 tbsp tahini or olive oil Zest and juice of one lime 2 tbsp nutritional yeast 1/2 cup water 1/2 tsp salt . Rinse and pick over dry beans. Soak beans in water overnight (you can use a quick boil method to help skip overnight soaking). Drain and rinse beans, add to a large pot and cover with 4 inches of fresh water. Add bay leaves and bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to low and lightly simmer for 1 to 2 hours or until tender. . While beans are cooking, add all of garlic herb mince ingredients to a food processor and process on high 30 seconds. Scrape down sides and process for another 30 seconds until mixture looks well blended and there are no large chunks. Set aside. . Once beans are tender, sauté onions in a separate pan until translucent then add 1/3 cup of the herb mixture and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Transfer this mixture to the beans along with the smoked paprika and stir to combine. Bring to a gentle boil and allow to cook for 15-20 minutes or until beans have thickened. Adjust salt to taste and serve. 🌱 . [INSTANT POT DIRECTIONS IN COMMENTS]>>>

Quarantine has me baking up a storm. 🌱Retested some muffins, made a loaf of bread and now some amazing vegan cookie mug cakes. I have the recipe here, but you can also find it on my blog. 🍪 . If you are asking yourself why you would want to make one, then let me set the mood. No big mess. Basic pantry ingredients. Cooks in the microwave in just 1 minute and 30 seconds. Tastes amazing, warm, gooey...did I sell you on it yet? 😂 . Vegan Cookie Mug Cake 4 tbsp flour of choice (I used spelt flour) 1/2 tsp baking powder 1 tbsp brown sugar Pinch of salt 2 tbsp natural peanut butter (other nut and seed butters work) 1/4 cup dairy free milk 1-2 tbsp chocolate chips . Add dry ingredients except chocolate chips in a mug. Add peanut butter and milk and whisk together with a fork. Fold in chocolate chips and place mug in the microwave for 1 minute and 30 seconds. Please note, every microwave is different. If you are worried yours might be set too high, microwave for 45-50 seconds first. Open the door, check doneness of cake and microwave for an additional 10 seconds until cake looks baked. Make sure to have enough space in your mug to allow your cake to rise. You can make this allergy friendly with a few swaps. . Use dairy free chocolate chips. Use the dairy free milk you prefer. Use oat flour, almond flour or 1 to 1 gluten free all purpose flour. Use a seed butter instead of nut butter to make nut free. 🍪 . Don’t burn your mouth! Wait for it to cool a little before taking a bite. ✨

Good morning everyone. Or maybe afternoon. I lose track of time these days. 🤷🏽‍♀️ Regardless, happy Friday from my bowl to yours. 🙂 Gooey maca oats with pb, blackberries, caramelized banana, hemp hearts and chocolate chips. 😚 . Maca Oats 1/3 cup rolled oats 1 tbsp ground flaxseed 1 mashed banana or replace with 2 tsp sweetener 1 tsp maca powder 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice or cinnamon 1 cup unsweetened almond milk Salt to taste . Add all ingredients to sauce pan, stir to combine and allow to cook and thicken for 5 minutes. I sautéed some diced pears until they were softened in cinnamon, 2 tsp maple syrup and a pinch of salt then added on top of the oats. 😛

It’s been forever and a day since I’ve had Thai curry. I’ve been thinking about it more now that we can’t go out to restaurants. But I improvised and made an inspired variety. Was so good! And to change it up I poured the amazing sweet curry sauce over some @lotusfoods rice noodles and 🤤🤤 . Thai Inspired Green Curry- 20 minutes 1 small onion, diced 4 cloves minced garlic 1 celery stalk, diced 5 mushrooms, quartered 1 can full fat coconut milk 2 tbsp Thai green curry paste* 1 tbsp low sodium soy sauce (gluten free) 1 tsp corn starch (optional) 1 tbsp sweetener (I used sugar in the raw) 1 block of baked tofu* 2-3 cups your veggies of choice, chopped (I used broccoli florets and red bell pepper) . In a separate small bowl whisk together cornstarch and 1 tbsp of water to make a slurry then set aside. In a large saucepan, add onion, celery and mushrooms. Sauté until onions are softened. Add in garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add a splash of coconut milk to the pan, stir and add the curry paste. Allow to cook for 2 minutes while sautéing. Add in remaining coconut milk, soy sauce and sweetener and stir well to combine. Bring mixture to a boil and then reduce heat to a low simmer. Add veggies in and stir well and allow to cook for 10-15 minutes or until veggies are fork tender. 5 minutes before end of cooking time, add in cornstarch slurry. Mix well to combine and allow to finish cooking. Top with baked tofu and serve overtop rice or rice noodles. Recipe serves 4. . For tofu, you can follow my tofu recipe that you can find on my blog, use preflavored tofu and bake or you can also just add a can of chickpeas to this when adding your veggies in. . For the curry paste, I use the Thai Kitchen brand. You can find in the international section of your store.

Cozying up to some oats this morning (but cozy up to a bowl of oats anytime of day). 🥣Topped with warm apple and chocolate chips. If you have the time before you start your day, highly recommend sautéing you’re apples. It’s just makes this super luxurious for a bowl of oats. ✨ . Banana Peanut Butter Oats 1/3 cup rolled oats 1 tbsp ground flaxseed 1 sliced banana or replace with 2 tsp sweetener 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice or cinnamon 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 1 tbsp peanut butter Salt to taste . Add all ingredients to sauce pan, stir to combine and allow to cook and thicken for 5 minutes. I sautéed some diced apples until they were softened in cinnamon, 2 tsp maple syrup and a pinch of salt then added on top of the oats. 😛 . For the apples, just chop one apple into cubes. Place in a pan with 2 tsp maple syrup, pinch of salt and pinch of cinnamon. Stir and sauté on low heat until maple syrup coats apples and apples slightly soften and brown. 🍎

Lentils have been so ridiculously satisfying recently. 🌱 The ultimate comfort for me at least. Thought I’d share this bowl with you all in case you need some dinner inspiration. 💫 . Spiced Veggie Lentil Stew 1/2 cup dry red lentils, rinsed well 1 cup green lentils, rinsed well 1 green bell pepper, diced 1 stalk celery, chopped 1/2 medium red/yellow onion, diced 1 15 oz can crushed tomatoes 2 tsp smoked paprika 1 tsp ground ginger or 1 inch fresh ginger minced 4 cloves garlic, minced 2 tsp dried basil 1/4 tsp cinnamon 2 tsp sazón @eatloisa 1 bay leaf 2 tsp sugar (optional; helps to cut the acid from the tomatoes) 1 small diced sweet potato 3 cups low sodium veggie broth 🥣 . In a large sauce pan, add in celery and onions and sauté until onions are softened. Add in green bell pepper, sweet potato, garlic and ginger. Sauté until fragrant the. add spice mix except bay leaf. Move spices around for a minute or until fragrant. Add in lentils and crushed tomatoes. Stir together then add in veggie broth. Bring mixture to a boil and add bay leaf. Reduce to a simmer and cover. Allow to cook for 25-30 minutes or until lentils are tender, cooked through and thickened. Remove from heat and stir before serving. 🥣

Happy Monday! ✨ Was missing oatmeal and needed a bowl to get me through the morning. Things that have been making my oats more exciting recently: . 🌱Cook oats with plant milk (I’ve been loving soy milk) 🌱Cook fruit/veggies into your oats (try banana, grated apples, grated zucchini, dried fruit, or frozen berries) 🌱 Soak a really flavorful tea into your oats (I like cookie flavored teas a lot) 🌱 Try different spices. Currently loving pumpkin spice and ginger notes. . Spiced Coconut Oatmeal 1/2 cup rolled oats 1/2 tbsp ground flax seed 1 tbsp coconut flakes 1 cup unsweetened almond/coconut milk 1/4 tsp pumpkin pie spice 1/2 tsp ginger Splash of vanilla extract Pinch of salt . Add all ingredients to a sauce pan and bring to a simmer. Stir and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes then remove from stove top. Top oats as desired and enjoy! 💜

It’s so interesting to go through my feed now. 🌱 Everyone has prepared so differently for staying at home. Different food priorities and if anything it’s pushing me to be very conscious of the things I share. 😬 . Salads right now are tough. I actually made this before quarantine. But! You can modify. If you don’t have greens, totally cool! Replace with rice, quinoa or extra roasted (squash, cauliflower, brussel sprouts, etc.). Instead of mixing the dressing in the greens, reserve and pour over salad if not using greens. Let me know if you need help making something similar. 🙃 . BBQ Chickpeas 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained 1 tbsp tahini 2 tbsp favorite BBQ sauce Pinch of salt . Place all ingredients in a bowl and toss together to coat chickpeas evenly. Bake on line baking sheet and place in the oven for 25 minutes. If you are using an airfrier, place chickpeas in airfrier and bake at 370F for 15 minutes or until crunchy. Remove chickpeas from oven and allow to completely cool. . Adobo Tahini Dressing 3 tbsp tahini Juice of one lemon 1 tsp miso paste 1/2 tsp smoked paprika 2 tsp maple syrup 1 tsp mustard 1/2 tsp garlic powder 1/4 tsp adobo seasoning 4 tbsp water Salt and pepper to taste . Smoky Adobo Chickpea Salad 1 romaine heart, chopped or 1 bagged salad BBQ Chickpeas 1 cup frozen fire roasted corn 1 avocado, chopped 1 cup roasted frozen broccoli 1/4 cup adobo tahini dressing . In a small bowl add in all dressing ingredients and whisk until smooth. Add more water 1 tbsp at a time if you want to make the consistency a little thinner to your liking. In a large bowl add greens and top with 1/2 the dressing. Toss to coat all romaine leaves. Toss in remaining ingredients plus remaining dressing and toss to coat again. Serve as desired. 🌱

Apples have become my favorite snack recently. 🥣 Mostly because they don’t spoil as easily. We had too many apples at one point this week so I diced them up and made a crumble. ✨ Considering I love apple and peanut butter, I made the crumble on top include pb to pay homage. Bake for a little longer and you get the gooey-ness of typical apple crumble. I chose to enjoy it more as a granola and serve with some @culinayogurt. So good. 🍎 . Baked Apple Crumble Granola/Regular Apple Crumble . For the Apples 4 apples, diced into small pieces 3 tbsp maple syrup Juice of one lemon 1 tsp pumpkin pie spice 1/2 tsp ginger powder . For the Oats 1 1/2 cups oats 3 tbsp peanut butter (or other nut and seed butter) 1 tbsp almond flour or all purpose flour 3 tbsp maple syrup Salt to taste . Set oven to 350F. In a bowl combine apples, lemon juice, pinch of salt and pumpkin pie spice. Toss together with clean hands and place it at the bottom of a baking dish. In a separate bowl, combine all oat crumble ingredients and stir to combine using a fork. It’s okay to see it clump, just make sure peanut butter is spread out as much between the oats as you can. With hands, evenly spread oat mixture over apples. Take baking tray and place in the oven. . For granola consistency, bake for 25-30 minutes. Apples should still be tender. . For actual apple crumble, add a tsp of corn starch to your apple mixture and allow to cook for longer, about 45-50 mins to allow apples to release moisture and fully soften. 🍎

This was going to be a completely different thing, but that’s okay. 🙃 Sometimes meals turn out that way. But this plate was definitely a happy accident. Sautéed Miso Cabbage and Tofu...pretty much all the veggies. 😂 Super yum flavor, lots of nice peppery notes as well as ginger and garlic. 😌This went perfect with a little @lotusfoods brown Jasmine rice. 🥕 . Sautéed Miso Cabbage and Tofu 1/4 of a medium cabbage, shredded 1 small onion 1 block extra firm tofu, pressed and drained 1 stalk celery 1 small carrot, sliced into coins 1 inch ginger minced 3 cloves garlic minced 2 tbsp low sodium soy sauce 2 tsp garlic chili sauce 2 tsp maple syrup 1 tsp miso paste 2 tbsp water 1/4 tsp black pepper Extra Veggies of choice: I use bell pepper, collards and parsley . Cube tofu and place to the side. In a small bowl, whisk together miso and water then set aside. In a sauté pan, add onions and celery and sauté until onions are softened. Add in carrots, cabbage, garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant. Add in soy sauce, garlic chili sauce and maple syrup and stir to coat. Add in remaining veggies and miso mixture. Stir and cook for a minute or until miso absorbs into the stir fry. Serve and enjoy. 🍚

Good morning, everybody! 🌻 I've managed to survive my morning commute to the kitchen to make a cup of hot tea and am safely back in my chair. It was a little touch-and-go rounding the corner of the dining table, but I made it! I am always traveling, so I ended up commuting back to the kitchen to make these pancakes. But don’t worry, I put on an apron to protect my work attire. You know...safety first! 🥞 . 😄 Hopefully that cheered someone up! But if not, I have these super fluffy whole grain blueberry pancakes to lift spirits. I may have thrown in an extra handful of chocolate chips too. 🍫 . The Fluffiest Whole Grain Pancakes 1 ripe banana 1 tbsp ground flax seeds 2 tbsp water 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar 1/2 tsp vanilla extract 1/4 tsp salt 2 tsp baking powder 1 tsp baking soda 1 tbsp sugar or maple syrup 1 1/2 cups white whole wheat flour 1 1/4 cups non-dairy milk 1/3 or more cups frozen blueberries Zest of one lemon (optional) . Preheat a griddle or pan. In a mixing bowl, add banana and with a whisk or fork mash banana until mostly smooth. Add in flax seed and water and give mixture a good stir and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Next add in apple cider vinegar, vanilla, salt, and sugar and mix this in well. Add in baking soda and baking powder. Stir well again and you will notice the mixture react and start to fluff up. Add in flour, zest and milk and mix to form a thick batter (avoid over mixing). Fold in blueberries into the batter. When griddle is ready, scoop 1/4 cup of pancake batter onto griddle surface and cook for 2-3 minutes or until bottom of pancake is golden. Flip and cook other side for 2-3 minutes as well. Remove from heat and eat. 🥞

Remove lid from soup cup then take seasoning packet out. Add water, 1/2 the seasoning packet and adobo seasoning to sauce pan and bring to a gentle boil.
